commit_message:
WIP: Add ECU setting for libvirt

ECU(Elastic Compute Unit) is for implementing the similar virtual
machine performance on several heterogeneous nova-compute servers.

There is the way to configure cpu_quota and cpu_period with flavor
extra_spec already. However, that way can not implement the similar
virtual machine performance on different performance servers.
We need the different ratio of cpu_quota and cpu_period for each
server performance for adjusting the virtual machine performance,
but the extra_spec of a flavor contains the same ratio of cpu_quota
and cpu_period.

This patch adds some configuration items for adjusting cpu_quota and
cpu_period on each nova-compute server.

Related to blueprint nova-ecu-support

Change-Id: I8835fa03d16792dfbec9a9f36f5171c8ea1e3e53

commit_message:
Refactor setup_logging

This change just cleans up the setup_logging function. It was
defined in keystone.common.config and then also exported from
keystone.config. Also, it had extra parameters that were unused.

This takes care of a NOTE (which probably should have been a
TODO) in the code.

Change-Id: I1a46c8974cbd68a5bf708d253adfadc1fdb76dcd

commit_message:
Change Port create API to EAFP

Port creation in API is LBYL, but should be EAFP, we have
UniqueConstraint on address column, just catch the exception and
handle to show client a useful information.

Change-Id: I6846e440c38543d4f4f19dae44d774df2e04107e
Closes-Bug: #1244348

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-08 13:35:32.000000000', 'message': 'Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself

test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri sets the global
libvirt.allow_default_uri_connection to False but it leaves
it in this state which could cause test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt
to fail if it ran immediately afterwards. This patch adds a cleanup
so _reset is called at the end of the test and not just if
another test in the same class is run after it.

Change-Id: I9762fcb81b2318beeb056c67bd9172056e1449ab
Closes-Bug: 1258553
'}]
commit_message:
Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself

test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri sets the global
libvirt.allow_default_uri_connection to False but it leaves
it in this state which could cause test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt
to fail if it ran immediately afterwards. This patch adds a cleanup
so _reset is called at the end of the test and not just if
another test in the same class is run after it.

Change-Id: I9762fcb81b2318beeb056c67bd9172056e1449ab
Closes-Bug: 1258553

@Stanislaw, I like the patch, but have a question - reading the BP it seems like you have an issue which needs you to lower the pool size (to match the memcache limit). What is that limit? (And also, do we need to keep the default pool size at 1000 or should we be reducing that size?)'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-11-08 13:10:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Davanum The issue I experienced is related to memcache connections, since they are always started per thread and are never shared. That means with 10 workers, you can get up to 10k connections from a single api host by default. Adjusting the pool size is not really a proper fix in my opinion, but a temporary workaround. The proper fix would be to implement a pool for memcache connections.

Whether the default pool size should change is a hard question. I don't have anything against 1k threads and I haven't seen it causing any other issues. My gut feel is that if we're handling more than 100 requests in one process, that's a sign of some other issue anyway, but that's probably not enough to change the default value..."}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-11-08 13:12:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For the record, I lowered the thread count to 100 in local environment with 20 workers. I haven't seen any issues with that config.

If the default is changed, maybe we could use something more intelligent than constants by default. For example 1000/num_workers ?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-11-11 14:55:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Allow configuring the wsgi pool size

Expose the number of greenthreads in wsgi pool to configuration. This
allows to put a limit to the number of resources like memcache
connections used.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I6e53d6e12661ed2f42a6b543891b13eec0c8300c

commit_message:
Install Guide: cinder setup for ceilometer fixes

* openstack-cinder-volume should be restarted, not
  openstack-cinder-agent-central
* use 'ceilometer' instead of 'cinder' in the section id

Change-Id: Id9cbab26ed8aa9d09b98da93576ff7aad8c304b7
Closes-Bug: #1259456
backport: havana

commit_message:
Remove deprecated code

Essex and keystoneclient 0.1.1 have deprecated and is no
longer supported by the Openstack project so remove
the keystoneclient tests for them.

Change-Id: Ia083ecbfa8e488fd33eb3e8c47fc532196de7ca8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

you're defaulting user's passwords to an empty string? that is NOT the same as not requiring a password. null should be an acceptable value"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-12-03 22:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

It is very insecure to set passwords to a default empty string.  There are a number of ways to approach this issue, but defaulting the password to a deterministic string is a very bad idea.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2013-12-03 23:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think this is right way to handle this issue. If the idea is to set the password to "something" when it is None, I would opt for a randomly generated string which would result in an unusable password until the password is reset, if so desired.  However, I also don't think that setting the password to "somthing" when it's None is the best way to do this. I think it would be better to disable password auth for a user if no password is presented.'}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2013-12-03 23:47:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Can't these functions be simplified to: http://paste.openstack.org/show/54394/"}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2013-12-04 17:30:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Forgot to voice my -1 on storing empty string as the password.  See my previous comment for a possible solution."}, {'account_id': 9450, 'date': '2013-12-04 17:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

David, I have already contacted to Dolph and he explain me the reason to have an user without pass. I probably use what you proposed + corresponding UT. commit_message:
Create user returns 400 without a password

If it is intended to create a new user without password (is optional)
keystone user-create --name <name>
keystone fails returning error 400.

The change consist in checking if the request has password: None
don't make the password hash

Co-Authored-By: huangtianhua<huangtianhua@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1245342
Change-Id: If6f5789dcec0610a237f286d0d17ad4b100ef5f3

commit_message:
Remove unused variables in neutron api interface and neutron tests

My local pyfakes checker in my editor keeps pointing these out
each time I save these files so I'd like to stop the messages.

Change-Id: I45a24af11434914be684d0944b49f4f746d48de4

[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:20:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: I0256cf4cc3aa7675956762dcf056e2709d36813a
'}]
commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: I0256cf4cc3aa7675956762dcf056e2709d36813a

subject: Updates tox.ini to use new features

This works fine on Fedora 19, with a "pip install -U tox" in order to get the 1.6.1 version.

It would be slightly easier for developers that use tox if we did not have to require this, since F19 is a major distribution that does not have that version of tox. commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I2042cae5ebf5467408fe6cdb71f6147081b72ca6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 15:14:35.000000000', 'message': "Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983
"}]
commit_message:
Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

We also had to adjust the pip command used.

Change-Id: I8894c0199db845e90e5086a7c0e6bb7c7a26b5a0

[{'created': '2013-12-11 18:42:32.000000000', 'message': 'Changing the way workflow Steps calculate if they have required fields.

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1260028
'}, {'created': '2013-12-11 20:16:18.000000000', 'message': 'Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1260028
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 23:26:19.000000000', 'message': 'Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1252005
'}]
commit_message:
Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1252005

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 00:47:29.000000000', 'message': "Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana
"}, {'created': '2013-12-12 21:01:44.000000000', 'message': "Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana
"}]
commit_message:
Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana

commit_message:
Enables H403 pep8 rules

Updates tox.ini to reduce ignored rules.

Updates code for H403 violation.

Change-Id: Iee7b34a27c62ce8cb0f26166b3c16e3386e2fecd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 01:34:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

The following patch removes an unneeded call to conductor to retrieve
data already available in instance.

Note: six.text_type() was added and wrapped around info_cache in some of
the tests. This was done because values from the db are in unicode
(text_type). The reason the test changed is because previously we
did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

Closes-bug: #1258360

Change-Id: I45a24af11534911be68fd0964b79fdf726d88de6
'}, {'created': '2013-12-06 19:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

data already available in instance.

did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

commit_message:
Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

The following patch removes an unneeded call to conductor to retrieve
data already available in instance.

Note: six.text_type() was added and wrapped around info_cache in some of
the tests. This was done because values from the db are in unicode
(text_type). The reason the test changed is because previously we
did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

Closes-bug: #1258360

Change-Id: I45a24af11534911be68fd0964b79fdf726d88de6

commit_message:
Make live migrations work for non volume-backed instances with RBD

* Add a new ceph user and pool for ephemeral storage
* Update nova configuration to store ephemeral volumes in RBD pool
* Open libvirt ports requred for live migration
* Restrict VNC traffic to management network

Change-Id: I772c6d94de4537ad82d4b62822bdc4f702e8ff56
Implements: blueprint ceph-live-migration

commit_message:
Add IPAddress field type in object models

In object models, there are ipv4 address type and ipv6 address type.
However, for some fields in models.py, for instance, host_ip in compute node,
and a bunch of IPAddress variables in network, and address in other tables.

There is no field type corresponding to them, no matter whether it is v4 or
v6. So, add one more field type in object models to specify that type.

Change-Id: Ic53ed644f4bbc1e280b2f8cbb9b9c145c3d8a2e9

LGTM, straight forward change.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

So, there are still several problems with the imports, with respect to how we want imports grouped.  The question, however, is: should we insist that the import grouping (including grouping errors introduced here) be fixed by this patch before approving, or should we consider that future work?  I would request that we insist the grouping errors introduced here be corrected, then work on disentangling the grouping elsewhere in a separate, follow-up patch.

For reference, imports are supposed to be split up into three groups, each alphabetized within themselves.  The first group is standard library imports, such as "os" and "base64".  The second group is third-party imports, such as "mock", "six", or "fixtures"; and the third group is novaclient imports.  Each group is separated from the others by a blank line.'}, {'account_id': 7806, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-12 18:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For the import grouping, hacking 0.9 will include checks for that.  So I would prefer to wait for that to be released, as that will make it easier to identify import grouping mistakes.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-12 18:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Enables H306 pep8 rules

Updates tox.ini to reduce ignored rules.

Updates code for H306 violation.

[{'created': '2013-12-02 18:54:06.000000000', 'message': "Add a control point for floating IP assignment

In the basic network scenario test, the test for accessiblity via the
floating IP stands a very good chance of failing because the attempt to
connect begins before the system has had a chance to associate the
floating IP address.  While an extended delay does signify a performance
issue for those types of operations, the timing of the test can be
adversly affected by other factors (e.g. parallel tests, loaded test
  system). If it is extreme the check for the IP address will fail the
test as well. This addition also covers a loophole in the test where
the connectivity would work but the metadata that is provided through
the client call is not updated properly.

There isn't a specific bug that this modification addresses.

Change-Id: Ifb1889f67588e6ee4d19f592da61ab574d456be2

commit_message:
Add a control point for floating IP assignment

In the basic network scenario test, the test for accessiblity via the
floating IP stands a very good chance of failing because the attempt to
connect begins before the system has had a chance to associate the
floating IP address.  While an extended delay does signify a performance
issue for those types of operations, the timing of the test can be
adversly affected by other factors (e.g. parallel tests, loaded test
  system). If it is extreme the check for the IP address will fail the
test as well. This addition also covers a loophole in the test where
the connectivity would work but the metadata that is provided through
the client call is not updated properly.

An additional small fix in manager.py resolves an issue when a client
API uses mixed or lower case for status strings (e.g. cinder).

There isn't a specific bug that this modification addresses.

Change-Id: Ifb1889f67588e6ee4d19f592da61ab574d456be2

I get that this is intended to be looked at by an operator of a real system, but the log-checker is not going to run in a real system. Shouldn't we be setting timeout params so they don't trigger errors when running in gate jobs? Looking at the swift code it appears that this particular timeout value is essentially hard-coded to 1. According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050
'}]
commit_message:
Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'

According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050

commit_message:
Set pipefail for wrapper scripts

Previously if the testr list command was failing subunit2py would
return a 0 making the test runs that use the pretty_tox scripts also
return 0 despite testr actually failing. This commit gets around this
condition by setting pipefail in the pretty_tox scripts to ensure that
we actually fail.

Change-Id: I9cbaf83cfea7c02133b27fe639e7ea12edb48f7e

commit_message:
Add API ref for FlavorDisabled extension

Added a new section, which should be accessible via
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-compute.html#os-flv-disabled
(after change merged)
which shows the sample responses in this directory:
api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/OS-FLV-DISABLED

More about the 'disabled' filed in 'flavor'
http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/zi7bkeqlnjbtkz5t

Patch2:
added missing file os-flv-disabled.wadl

Patch3:
Using sentence-style caps for titles

Use <literal></literal> tag to surround OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled

Change tenant_id to be of type "xsd:string" from the name space
xmlns:xsd="http://docs.rackspacecloud.com/xsd/v1.0"

Change-Id: Ida174590303b46fe7c8b2ca4ce26a1632daf2762
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1089019

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to console output virt driver api

Update the get_console_output() method of the virt driver API to be
defined to accept an Instance object.  While we're at it, pass the
context, as well.

Change-Id: If325a39f6314cff936e604fcc5816deefbb1199b

subject: Send Instance object to validate_console_port

commit_message:
Send Instance object to validate_console_port

Update the validate_console_port() method of the compute rpc api to take
in an Instance object instead of a dict.  The object_compat() decorator
is used to ensure the change is backwards compatible, and that the code
will still work if it receives an instance in dict format.

Change-Id: Ief8fabc8490315acb41bf85ad421683fea31daf9

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in test_utils and nova.tests.utils

Renames occurrences of 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in
nova.tests.test_utils and nova.tests.utils along with any impacted tests
using the changed parts.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Ie816356c176c2be61b4a346a4d47d8f3461ae84a

reverify no bug no longer works. We did that to force people to debug gate failures and submit bugs if existing bugs do not already exist. This looks like a pbr integration test failure to start keystone properly via devstack. I would submit a bug against pbr and devstack with traceback in the keystone log, a link back to this change and the failing test logs, and some initial debugging (note projects are marking bugs invalid if they only contain a traceback).'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-12-14 13:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix typos in documents

Fix typos detected by toolkit misspellings.

 * pip install misspellings
 * git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Closes-Bug: #1257295
Change-Id: Ibb5917ab5af541a381630bd013b05d22badd4364

Function of get_pid_file doesn't simply do the readonly operation of
obtaining pid_file. Change the function name to better describe its
purpose

"}]
commit_message:
rename get_pid_file to ensure_get_pid_file

Function of get_pid_file doesn't simply do the readonly operation of
obtaining pid_file. Change the function name to better describe its
purpose

Change-Id: Ieb892393897e9bf9fdfde2fb8ee1384cd188ac0a

commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H702

Formatting operations should be outside of localization,
otherwise translation lookup will never find a translated
string as a match. This also fixes H701 alongway.

Change-Id: I6708e0f5b11841b18ba9042ac4958643f91396dd

commit_message:
Add disabled_reason field to services table

Add a column (String 255) in the services table to store
disabled_reason field.

Change-Id: I3cc03029831bdf6a52e9b65c673794430807aeee
Implements part of bp record-reason-for-disabling-service

I'd rather not add two more sed processes and a brittle substitution.  If pipe is an issue let's just use a delimiter that isn't, like say, "\000" (NULL).

  local sep=$(echo -ne "\x01")
  sed -i -e "/^\[${section}\]/,/^\[.*\]/ s${sep}^\(${option}[ \t]*=[ \t]*\).*${sep}\1${value}${sep}" "$file"'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-12-11 16:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-12-11 16:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

to be injected.

and back after the injection.

Fixes bug #1258050

Change-Id: I8882c2f3f177ebdfa0c66270dbbc7fd50f30b065

commit_message:
Handle the case of pipe char in value for iniset

iniset did not handle the case of "|" in the value
to be injected. Fix this by replacing | with \000 (NULL).

Fixes bug #1258050

Change-Id: I8882c2f3f177ebdfa0c66270dbbc7fd50f30b065

[{'created': '2013-12-12 21:16:49.000000000', 'message': "remove a spurious wait that could get us into trouble

it's not really clear that this wait is useful for anything
except generating bugs when we've done terible things to the
image during this test. Removing it as unneeded.

Change-Id: I88546bf3845d8e62d4baf5572f0403c0eaa983ba
Closes-Bug: #1229890
"}]
commit_message:
remove a spurious wait that could get us into trouble

it's not really clear that this wait is useful for anything
except generating bugs when we've done terible things to the
image during this test. Removing it as unneeded.

Change-Id: I88546bf3845d8e62d4baf5572f0403c0eaa983ba
Closes-Bug: #1229890

I think there are several reasons why this work should be abandoned:
 - applying auto spell correction creates more problems than it solves (see test results)
 - it's hard to review 4k+ changed lines
 - the misspelled words are number 1 problem on openstack's problem list, if counted from the end"}, {'account_id': 7770, 'date': '2013-12-14 13:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Scripted spelling correction is not a good idea, in hindsight. However, those should be fixed at some point. Abandoning this for now.'}]

Correct spellings of some words

The mistakes were found by running
git ls-files | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: I235175f67b6f0ca2242128f0d535c5ab2067f303
Closes-Bug: #1257295

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 23:13:07.000000000', 'message': "Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

[{'created': '2013-12-11 14:27:31.000000000', 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neturon to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occuring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}, {'created': '2013-12-11 20:39:22.000000000', 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

commit_message:
Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450

commit_message:
Support warning messages in SelfHandlingForm

Sometimes we need to show a prominent message at the top of a form to
warn the user about something. One example is trying to snapshot an
in-use volume.

Change-Id: I073fe6bd049eb90b7a6ed45abfad96ebda3510eb
Related-Bug: #1202929

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,

Closes-Bug: #1256049

commit_message:
Fix missing policy enforcement in CFN API

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,
and rework the test to illustrate the issue.

Change-Id: Ia5c2e65512ab9d1c163171f8617c081ab96745e5
Closes-Bug: #1256049

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-25 13:33:56.000000000', 'message': "Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client
API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the
latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors
environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c
"}, {'created': '2013-12-10 12:12:59.000000000', 'message': "Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c
"}]
commit_message:
Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c

[{'created': '2013-12-12 17:00:27.000000000', 'message': "Don't save mysql logs

Currently a full tempest run produces 600MiB of _compressed_ log data,
of which 324MiB are mysql logs.  This is because devstack configures
the mysql slow query log to log every query.  This seems like an
excessive level of debugging for the gate, so lets not save those
logs.

Change-Id: Ib4cdfc929b93b289916295ff365a46979555a574
"}]
commit_message:
Don't save mysql logs

Currently a full tempest run produces 600MiB of _compressed_ log data,
of which 324MiB are mysql logs.  This is because devstack configures
the mysql slow query log to log every query.  This seems like an
excessive level of debugging for the gate, so lets not save those
logs.

Change-Id: Ib4cdfc929b93b289916295ff365a46979555a574

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to compute vnc rpc api

Pass a real Instance object to the get_vnc_console() method of the
compute rpc api.  The object_compat() decorator is used to provide
backwards compatibility with receiving data in the old format.

Change-Id: Ib615fd653e0ef6196241fde81f541b1e18eb3ced

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 02:39:18.000000000', 'message': 'Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: Ia1828425d246601b6e1403c59f1768b6ae593afc
Closes-Bug: #1242815
'}]
commit_message:
Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: Ia1828425d246601b6e1403c59f1768b6ae593afc
Closes-Bug: #1242815

commit_message:
Added 'gcc' to requirements in dev instructions

Tox fails to create savanna virtual environment without gcc.

Change-Id: I608194a651755159ad1e9dc36610d648c8372670

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I87f172cfcc44c9afff9c5162791d6c6b31972702

commit_message:
HTTPretty: update to 0.7.1

The 0.7.1 release has a fix for the parse_querystring function, which raised a
TypeError on Python 3.3. See:

https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/commit/5c6e776

This helps fix some tests on Python3.3 in python-keystoneclient.

Change-Id: If14a0afe9d42602e978377d6f6ee830affe0cc41

commit_message:
Don't replace (and log) the same resource entry

Resources may be registered multiple times. This
ensures that logs are only emitted the first time
a resource is registered.

Change-Id: Iedd12d55007ee24ea6ecbe4fe7152ff65ea665b0

'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-11-26 16:23:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This looks a bit complicated for me. I'm afraid that such approach will cause a lot of troubles in the future.

Can't we just obtain latest supported version from the single object itself?

Example:
objclass = cls.obj_class_from_name(objname, objver)
objclass.VERSION"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-11-26 16:38:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, the thing servicing the request to list all instances (conductor) may be newer than the client making the request (compute). Conductor's instance object version may not the same as Compute's, and since all it knows is the version of the list at the point in which it's doing this operation, we can use that to know which version of Instance the client supports (if we adopt this rule).

The alternative approach is to change how all list methods are called so that we have some protocol for specifying the version of the sub-object that we know about. However, once we have an object version registry that conductor can look at, this suddenly becomes much easier."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-11-26 16:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Ok you know it better.

It just seems to me that we replace one crappy code with another cause we have to make to many changes to fix simple bugs'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-11-26 18:49:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It's not ideal, I definitely agree. However, this is not protocol over the wire, which means we can change it later. Even still, making a change which would normally require updating a version in the object just requires that you bump the list version as well. The unit test being in place helps you remember to do it.

I'm going to -1 this because I'm about to push up a small revision."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-11-26 20:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-11-26 20:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-25 22:53:00.000000000', 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Closes-bug: #1254902
'}, {'created': '2013-11-26 14:42:46.000000000', 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

commit_message:
Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Related-Bug: #1258256
Closes-Bug: #1254902

commit_message:
Make Instance object compatible with older compute nodes

This teaches the Instance object how to make itself compatibile with
older compute nodes running code from a few revisions ago.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I3fe7d89751ad191c24cf6daa7e281eb480e83e1f

commit_message:
Python3: replace urllib by six.moves.urllib

This makes the code compatible with both Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I721a5567842f2df6ce2a8af501787204daba3082

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1259750

Change-Id: I52afac28a3248895bb1c012a5934d39e7c2cc5a9

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-12-06 06:37:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(The same comment as a comment of launchpad bug)

In theory Neutron allows a network without subnet, so it seems be a bug of Neutron. The proposed patch prevents users from launching an instance without an IP address. It is not a case of Cloud data center, but there is a case. IMO Horizon should not block such feature.

Before merging the proposed patch, we need to investigate if the current OpenStack (nova + neutron) does not support a network without subnet. I know it does not work one or one-half years ago.

In addition, Nova should provide more intuitive error message and Dashboard should display it."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-14 06:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-14 06:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Filter valid networks to appear in create instance modal dialog

Applied a filter to select networks with subnets to the list
of available networks in the create instances form.

Closes-Bug: #1237711
Change-Id: I35e781041e8957d52b9ec974ac5507e593a793f5

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-09-13 18:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

This proposal has multiple issues that are blockers:

1) It introduces a new status for the port resource which is not specified in the API.  It is too late to change this behavior for Havana.

2) The patch assumes that a port will be associated with only one subnet.  That is not always the case.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-09-13 20:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-09-14 09:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Oleg for working on this.

I agree it should not be merged in Havana. The change is not planned in Horizon too in Havana cycle.

IMO it needs a discussion how to represent a status of a resource which is deleted asynchronously. A port used by dhcp-agent is a first case and it is better to make a consensus and well-documented how to represent such transitional status. Regarding the spec, the API spec allows a plugin to define additional status other than ACTIVE/DOWN/ERROR/BUILD but it is better to make a consensus about it.  The point Armando pointed is important too. We need to take into account how to delegate a plugin to manage resource status in the implementation.

Sorry for my less input about this issue.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-09-16 08:04:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Thanks for reviews guys! Agree that it's too late for Havana. Need to handle plugins that do not use dhcp agent and dhcp port association with several subnets cases at least."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-09-17 14:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-17 14:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Mark dhcp ports as pending delete on subnet deletion

For plugins that use dhcp agent the deletion of dhcp ports
is done asynchronously so horizon displays the port after subnet deletion.
Need to mark such ports as pending delete to let
horizon filter and not display them

Change-Id: Ib99f07316232094cb344f68f116659c9cb462ca3
Closes-Bug: #1131730

for fedora and suse environment. We shall also do this for ubuntu env

commit_message:
restart rabbit, in ubuntu environment

Currently in restart_rpc_backend function, we only restart rabbitmq
for fedora and suse environment. We shall also do this for ubuntu env

Change-Id: Ia0fe3dcf1ef68c5ef74a8f9ad80c0732bfc16502

commit_message:
Add ironic exercise in devstack

Sanity check that ironic started if enabled.
The step in ironic exercise will be added gradually in the future.

RUN_EXERCISES=ironic ./exercise.sh
This command will trigger ironic exercise separately in devstack.

Change-Id: Ifd99f737c40c24ab81c020b8b22243c106e18ace
Closes-Bug: #1256635

By logical, we shall first cleanup_*, install_*.
The two steps actually have no dependency,
thus we shall be safe for the reorder

Change-Id: I279732311cfe1cb1f73c1a2b1bec2005f9a43bf0
'}]
commit_message:
change order of cleanup_* and install_*

By logical, we shall first cleanup_*, install_*.
The two steps actually have no dependency,
thus we shall be safe for the reorder

Change-Id: I279732311cfe1cb1f73c1a2b1bec2005f9a43bf0

commit_message:
nova tests fail when run in a virtual environment

The virConnect object signature expects Uri and Readonly
parameters that the test is not passing. Fixed the test by
calling the virConnect object with all the required parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1257813
Change-Id: Ib79800a87dd64ba317fe15ee2bf19b696a3765b9

[{'created': '2013-12-03 08:14:18.000000000', 'message': "WIP POC of overview page

Just putting things together, to see what we are missing from ceiloemter

- To have reliable history, we are missing support of mongo's 'distinct'.
  It should land at I2 with bp complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries

Implements bp project-overview-page-ceilometer

Change-Id: I15ae63c4919f9dfbc4d37f746e42088d8f528534
"}, {'created': '2013-12-06 11:29:26.000000000', 'message': "WIP POC of overview page

Just putting things together, to see what we are missing from ceiloemter

- To have reliable history, we are missing support of mongo's 'distinct'.
  It should land at I2 with bp complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries

Implements bp project-overview-page-ceilometer

Change-Id: I15ae63c4919f9dfbc4d37f746e42088d8f528534
"}]
commit_message:
WIP POC of overview page

Just putting things together, to see what we are missing from ceiloemter

- To have reliable history, we are missing support of mongo's 'distinct'.
  It should land at I2 with bp complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries

Implements bp project-overview-page-ceilometer

Change-Id: I15ae63c4919f9dfbc4d37f746e42088d8f528534

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the
flow, so I decided to operate with tasks' names instead of uuids in
storage. Task uuid now is only used to store task details.

Benefits of this refactoring: speed and memory optimizations and
code clean-up, user-friendly logs (task_name is printed instead of uuid).

Change-Id: I42235fb393a3a2ee1a25139d6d91602131d12456

commit_message:
Do not create TaskAction for each task

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the
flow, so I decided to operate with tasks' names instead of uuids in
storage. Task uuid now is only used to store task details.

Benefits of this refactoring: speed and memory optimizations and
code clean-up, user-friendly logs (task_name is printed instead of uuid).

Change-Id: I42235fb393a3a2ee1a25139d6d91602131d12456

(1 inline comment)

Nice.  A couple of suggestions inline.

I think we should be able to add something like this: https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/tests/unit/test_log.py#L183 to verify the log message is being output."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-12-05 16:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

It occurs to me that I shouldn't -1 this if we want more eyes on it and I'm not too worried about it getting stealth merged on me. :-)"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-12-05 17:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Agree with @Ben on tempfile.gettempdir() (see inline comment)'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-12-05 17:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This goes from fail-closed to fail-open, which is always a trade-off of convenience/avaialbility and security.

The risk of being in the fail-open state of using /tmp for locks is that malicious users can DOS operations by holding on to the lock. Opening with "append" mode is better than "truncate", so that does prevent the symlink attack. However this is still a risk and one can't just assume users will mine the logs and see these warnings. They will however detect a service that is not running.

Since the fail-closed is deterministic, I think it is fine to just fail and require adding the option. This is a really normal thing. There are also software library upgrades needed, and a whole host of other things that will likely fail is somebody just slaps this code on their server and tries to run it.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-05 17:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

so if there is a malicious user on the box, don't they have tons of other ways to trivially DOS the service? generate io workloads, fork bombs, etc. We could narrow the DOS vulnerability by also failing if the file was owned by not the user in question."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-12-05 17:55:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If the locks can be single-user, then shared memory locking will work better anyway. But to keep things using fcntl for simplicity, yes you can verify the owner is you. There is no race if you never remove the file, since the user wouldn't be able to transfer ownership to you.

I had thought that one desire was to keep these multi-user capable."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-05 20:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-05 20:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

I guess the other option here is to leave the current broken behavior in for a deprecation cycle and log an error when we fall back to that.  I still don't love that option either, but it doesn't appear there is going to be a perfect solution to this."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-06 17:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@client the current default, but the time this actually hits a project, is actually *EXPLODE*, and hope the shrapnel doesn't hit you. Because there is no default.

This at least provides a default that runs with an error.

Anyway, I'm going to leave this patch as is at this point, it will either merge or expire. If we want those cinder patches to land we need some better solution than give up on upgrades. This is the best I could think of. I'd happily love to see something better from someone else."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-14 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

[{'created': '2013-12-05 16:26:04.000000000', 'message': "provide a global default for lock dir

this is based on one proposed upgrade path for cinder on the
openstack-dev mailing list. Instead of making oslo lockutils error
if the user has not added a config variable for lock path in their
service (which they never needed to do before) use /tmp instead.

in order to address the security concerns of file truncation attacks,
open the files for locking in 'a' mode, which will make them non
destructive to the underlying files. Add tests to ensure that we
don't truncate underlying files.

also throw an error message to the user that this isn't a safe
mode to run in. That will hopefully mean they will only use this
for the small window of rolling their cluster forward, then
configure it to something more sane.

(note: this patch could use tests for that log message, comments
about how to mock that correctly in oslo would be appreciated.)

Change-Id: Ia96a8926741464cf0d47d2c25c77b9c746c1b334

commit_message:
provide a global default for lock dir

this is based on one proposed upgrade path for cinder on the
openstack-dev mailing list. Instead of making oslo lockutils error
if the user has not added a config variable for lock path in their
service (which they never needed to do before) use tempdir instead.

in order to address the security concerns of file truncation attacks,
open the files for locking in 'a' mode, which will make them non
destructive to the underlying files. Add tests to ensure that we
don't truncate underlying files.

also throw an error message to the user that this isn't a safe
mode to run in. That will hopefully mean they will only use this
for the small window of rolling their cluster forward, then
configure it to something more sane.

Change-Id: Ia96a8926741464cf0d47d2c25c77b9c746c1b334

commit_message:
Add script to test all example metadata

We want to test every element that has a README.md. This will run the
test utility for each one, and report back if any failed. This is
intended to be a target for tox.ini.

Change-Id: I30806eeea979c3ad48c2e874b4e1f49da48444fb

Build succeeded.

- gate-noop http://logs.openstack.org/54/60054/3/check/gate-noop/3260abe : SUCCESS in 2s
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-12-04 21:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-12-04 21:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-05 02:56:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like the idea but:

 - The code for this doesn't belong in tie : this is something other elements repos will want

 - merging the config fragment from a README.md with a template will often, legitimately not configure everything. So I'm not sure what it tells us. 

 - The test script is itself complex enough to warrant tests."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-12-05 07:06:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We're basically just going to catch template rendering errors here. We could go further and have sets of (input metadata, desired rendering) tests to catch more subtle issues like I398ba7bca46b66031e6ed68611fdd86f839c7cbc and have these tests stored in e.g. elements/*/tests/os-apply-config. It could be a pain to keep the tests up to date as we evolve the configs though.

I'm not bothering reviewing in any detail since lifeless wants the whole thing re-worked, but IMHO the basic idea here is fine as a first cut to merge and then we can iterate on it later."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-12-06 17:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

lifeless has convinced me to move this to os-apply-config.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-14 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-14 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Create tests for example metadata and templates

It can be difficult to test these things in their natural environment as
typically one must build an image and deploy it. test-example-metadata
encourages making the example metadata in README.md parsable. We also
attempt to merge it with any os-apply-config templates in the element.

Change-Id: I8c92e8a4808d8c76014fa74279d8a3bbffc017c7

Add services and useful options to samples/localrc

Add more options to samples/localrc with options to
enable the different services of development components
Added other few useful options as well.

commit_message:
Ensure posted size is compared with remote size and kills if different

This patch ensures the posted size is compared with downloaded imag
size when using --copy-from and kills the image if size differs
(behaving consistently with uploads from posted data).

Also fixes a few tests succeeding because of previous incorrect
behaviour which was assuming image size being the value posted and not
the value calculated from image data.

Change-Id: I08cef2143a5963c3f3c3412208cf3376299f2231
Close-Bug: 1256593

commit_message:
Update Lockutils from oslo

In future patch will be used oslo module test_migrations.py with updated
lockutils function, therefore as a first step we must update lockutils
module.

Patch is needed for Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Dependences: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50920/ (should be reviewed)

Change-Id: I794e2f22cc891ffeaeb95c535577997eca7cce48

self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with

Closes-Bug: #1230127

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

Change-Id: I190e2120fbf6d3fd33be98a2cf49faac19af0ea6
Closes-Bug: #1230127

commit_message:
Implement adopt-stack

Create a stack using already existing resources
(resources that were abandoned with abandon-stack operation)

Blueprint adopt-stack
Change-Id: I1cb3fd55de378b9d500cc6b690a41369a2fd76ae

[{'created': '2013-10-30 17:51:12.000000000', 'message': "Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1

commit_message:
Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 08:33:35.000000000', 'message': "Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696
Closes-Bug: #1223450
"}, {'created': '2013-10-28 08:33:35.000000000', 'message': "Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696
Closes-Bug: #1223450
"}, {'created': '2013-11-08 06:01:20.000000000', 'message': "Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

The cache in trusted_filter does not work because a new instance of
TrustedFilter is made each time, which creates it's own cache.
This means that each time a new instance is scheduled, the TrustedFilter
will query the attestation service for all hosts - which is a very slow
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1223450
Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696
"}, {'created': '2013-11-11 04:36:32.000000000', 'message': "Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

The cache in trusted_filter does not work because a new instance of
TrustedFilter is made each time, which creates it's own cache.
This means that each time a new instance is scheduled, the TrustedFilter
will query the attestation service for all hosts - which is a very slow
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1223450

commit_message:
Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

The cache in trusted_filter does not work because a new instance of
TrustedFilter is made each time, which creates it's own cache.
This means that each time a new instance is scheduled, the TrustedFilter
will query the attestation service for all hosts - which is a very slow
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1223450
Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696

commit_message:
handle multiple directories in fixup_stuff.sh

When echo /*, we may have multiple entries.
If so, die with error,instead of blinding assumping

Change-Id: I6a778192b3f352d4a603a8fe7102c9511612eb4f

I still am unable to find the correlation_id in the nova api logs.  

This needs a DocImpact flag as well

Furthermore, from the BP I have 2 more questions:

1) How do you plan to add the correlation ID to subsequent requests (such as to glance) Will you be modifying the python-glanceclient?

2) How will you prevent users from setting a, correlation_id? If a user can specify one is there any risk of the correlation_id being an unbound size?

I do see the value of this, but simple log parsing can already track requests that span multiple services by tracking pulling the request IDs from the log files.  So I see this BP as making things a little easier, but not adding a new ability.'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-05-23 05:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

1) How do you plan to add the correlation ID to subsequent requests (such as to glance) Will you be modifying the python-glanceclient?
-Yes, we will have to make the change in python-glanceclient to send the header across.
 
2) How will you prevent users from setting a correlation_id? If a user can specify one is there any risk of the correlation_id being an unbound size?
-We will not be able to prevent users from setting the correlation id themselves. We could put in a check to ensure that it is of the required size.

Also, I had a question on the logs that we see in jenkins. If the devstack instance already has a 'logging_context_format_string' set in nova.conf, it doesn't take the format set through code. Is this the correct assumption?
On my local devstack instance, when I remove the default string format set in nova.conf, and restart nova-api, the correlation_id gets logged. Is there any work-around, how does this get managed in production environment?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-05-30 07:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2013-05-30 21:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

One item that needs to be done is to update the nova/etc/nova/nova.conf.sample  file with the new default string.
nova/tools/conf/generate_sample.sh  can be used to make the diff.

For the devstack run during Jenkins, it also has a hardcoded  logging_context_format_string in devstack/lib/nova and devstack/lib/cinder that would need to be updated before we see output in the logs.'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-05-31 11:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-03 20:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This patch needs to be rebased.

Even though requests can be tracked cross project with intelligent log parsing, making this blueprint only provide a slightly better solution, at the cost of many patches to many projects.  And there is the concern of not being able to rely on this for any sort of trusted source of truth, as a user can easily tamper with it (most likely just reuse a request ID over and over again).  If others think this is worth it, that is fine with me.

But -1, as I would like to see a pending patch to python-glanceclient (or any other client nova uses) before accepting this into nova'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-06-08 08:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-08 08:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-06-14 02:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I see you add correlation_id to glance api requests, but why not add the correlation_id to Glance, Quantum and Cinder api requests at the same time?'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-06-14 04:52:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We have planned to implement this correlation_id feature one service at a time. Thats the reason we've just made the Glance changes as part of this commit."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-18 11:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would like to see the glance side patch proposed before merging this. As this patch is useless without at least one other project using it."}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-06-20 07:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Review in Glance: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33781/'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-25 18:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

Thanks, no + since I have not had a chance to actually test out this code.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-26 19:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks pretty good, going to let Joe have a chance to test it before approving.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Again, looks good, will give Joe another chance to test it.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-07-03 14:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Do not merge

So I like this idea -- pass a unique identifier among services to help admins track tasks between multiple log files, without the hassle of relating all the service-specific UUIDs.

However... AFAICT, this header is being exposed in the API and could be set by an end user. The user would derive no value from it -- they, presumably, don't have access to the service log files. Therefor, they should not be able to set it. 

An example of the badness of this, imagine what would happen if a user added "X_CORRELATION_ID=unicorn" to all their requests. This field would become useless to the admin!

I'm -2'ing since there are already some +2's and I'd like to make sure this is addressed before it merges.'}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-07-03 15:20:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We discussed a bit about this too.
The problem here is that we will not be able to differentiate
between a customer setting this value in the headers as against Nova adding
it to the request. One safety measure we could take is to put a check on the
format of the this header value (Say, a limit on the number of characters.)
Though it would be of no use to the customer, we benefit a lot from it to trace requests across services. So do you think that ensuring right format of values is enough in this case?
Even if the user sets the value to 'unicorn', we would still benefit from it, is what I think. Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-07-03 16:05:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I do not like exposing functionality to the users which is a) of no value to them, b) not something they should ever use, and c) detrimental to the admin if the user does something stupid.

Is there another way to generate these correlation_id in such a way that they couldn't come from the user? Perhaps offload it to keystone? Or detect if the API request is not coming from another OpenStack service and, if so, ignore that header. This seems like a good argument for having public (user) vs. private (admin) API endpoints."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-07-03 16:24:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@deva What do you suggest?

I agree that this is a potential nuisance, though I can't think of an easy solution to it."}, {'account_id': 7531, 'date': '2013-07-17 08:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I do not know of any way to differentiate between a request coming from another Openstack service and end user.
Since this is not going to be exposed as a functionality/api or adding any business value to the end user, it doesn't seem like a major issue. 
Offloading it to keystone - Not all requests need to talk to keystone.
After getting the auth token, we could cache and use it for subsequent requests."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-17 22:06:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Do not merge

The problem is that this isn't a user facing feature -- but the user can see/interact with it."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-07-18 14:13:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Joe and Devananda here.  A soft argument is that letting it in as is diminishes the motivation to go about solving this a better way.

And I have concerns about something using this for some purpose and then not being able to close it up later."}, {'account_id': 7531, 'date': '2013-07-19 11:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Is there a way to find if a request is coming from an end user and not from another Openstack service? Any ideas around it?'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:15:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Do not merge

How about this?

1) Distributed a single, shared secret key.
2) Digitally sign the header value with the key.
3) Unsigned or invalid header values are assumed to generated by a user or otherwise corrupted.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-19 20:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Brian that sounds like a significant CPU overhead for something fairly small'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-08-05 15:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hello,

>However... AFAICT, this header is being exposed in the API and could be set by an end user. The user would derive no value from it -- they, presumably, don't have access to the service log files. Therefor, they should not be able to set it.

From what I understand this is the main reason why this change is not accepted.
There is no way to prevent user from setting this header.

Even if request-id is going to be encrypted user will be able to send real request obtain real request-id and send it multiple times to different services.

I think that it's not a big problem if user will be able to set request-id with his own value for several reasons:
1) this might be useful for profiling and testing purposes and request-id will match test scenario being run
2) In case wrong request-id usage several requests will be associated incorrectly. This will not cause any security problems or big performance issues for the cloud.

I think that pros of such request-id outweigh the cons of exposing this header to users"}, {'account_id': 7532, 'date': '2013-12-05 04:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Restored

Blueprint has been approved. Restoring change.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-05 04:27:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Personally I don't think this is a security flaw, it's more of a potential nuisance.

Reading comments on the blueprint and etherpad it looks like this review is still valid, but folks also want to generate a notification at service boundaries.  (out of scope here, of course)"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-12-05 16:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

The result from the HKG discussion was that we won't have a unified request-id across services, but we'll log id from services when we call out to them so we can trace the request with some post processing. commit_message:
Implements Cross Service Unified Request id

The correlation_id that is generated by the oslo-incubator
middleware is added to the RequestContext and is logged along
with the request_id, to enable more effective debugging
of requests that span multiple services.

Change-Id: I26e288ac3425b609863d40c0c9da51ae3f04effb
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-29 04:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191
'}, {'created': '2013-12-05 20:34:33.000000000', 'message': 'Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement
List->Map->Schema, and this continues to work).

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191
'}]
commit_message:
Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement
List->Map->Schema, and this continues to work).

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191

commit_message:
Switch create volume commands to Taskflow 0.1.1

- Old TaskFlow code was removed from Cinder.

- TaskFlow 0.1.1 was added to Cinder requirements.

- Create volume flows for volume.api, volume.manager and
  scheduler.manager were updated to use taskFlow 0.1.1

Partially implements: blueprint create-volume-flow
Change-Id: Idbac8d001436f02978b366fbb3205ce84c847267

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 22:27:16.000000000', 'message': 'Bring obj server unit tests to > 98%

This set of changes attempts to bring the unit test coverage to over
98% for the object server module.

Two changes to the object server are made with this patch:

1. The try/except block around diskfile.write_metadata() was removed
   at the end of the POST method

The write_metadata() method of the DiskFile module does not raise
either the DiskFileNotExist or DiskFileQuarantined exceptions on that
code path.

2. The conditional container_update() call was removed at the end of
   the PUT method

The container_update() calls is performed when a new object is created
or when an exist object is updated. Since we already report old
timestamps as 409s (Conflict) we always perform the update.

We also fix an existing test to clear the hash prefix so that it can
actually detect the async pending pickle file creation for a failure
mode.

Change-Id: I71ec9dcf7c0ac86e56aa0f06993d501fdfa22d5b
'}]
commit_message:
Bring obj server unit tests to > 98%

This set of changes attempts to bring the unit test coverage to over
98% for the object server module.

Two changes to the object server are made with this patch:

1. The try/except block around diskfile.write_metadata() was removed
   at the end of the POST method

The write_metadata() method of the DiskFile module does not raise
either the DiskFileNotExist or DiskFileQuarantined exceptions on that
code path.

2. The conditional container_update() call was removed at the end of
   the PUT method

The container_update() calls is performed when a new object is created
or when an exist object is updated. Since we already report old
timestamps as 409s (Conflict) we always perform the update.

We also fix an existing test to clear the hash prefix so that it can
actually detect the async pending pickle file creation for a failure
mode.

Change-Id: I71ec9dcf7c0ac86e56aa0f06993d501fdfa22d5b

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I80e336ca2d5436188bcf89a03bb006d3c4767e61

commit_message:
Encode exception on ceilometer-client for UnicodeDecodeError

Current ceilometer client did not handle output exception which
is encoded, this patch implements the shell encoding for exception
output.

Change-Id: I3cddb277868e39765eccd68dc256f07e15a4207b

commit_message:
Fixes documentation building

 - Adds the ability to build docs using tox
 - Fixes autodoc generation

A Sphinx extension is introduced in the commit to facilitate building
the API documentation. This extension should be removed when
bug 1260495 is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibf5e5403cb7d3e67947c87b2828b64a56a11fc30

The same patch is proposed to nova so I'd like to see this fleshed out here first.

One thought is rather than completely error out and break the upgrade case as Duncan points out, we could dump a warning and adjust the values to be the defaults from the config file.  Adding to that, I think neutron is taking a stance that they recommend something like the service_down_time being at least 2 times bigger than the report_interval.  So say we detect the situation, log a warning and automatically change service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5 or something like that?"}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-12-10 00:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:
