"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-12-10 15:10:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

I'm not sure I understand the question about service_down_time versus report_interval, they are both configurable and we can only change one of them based on the value of the other.

Trying to think of cases, if the user increased the report_interval to have services check in more often, then it would make sense to adjust the service_down_time to accommodate that.  But if the user decreased the service_down_time to make the services show as offline more often, then it would make sense to change report_interval to account for that.  I think the former case is more realistic, but I don't like guessing as to what the user did.

Thinking out loud, one could compare the values against the defaults to determine what the user changed and then adjust accordingly, but maybe that's overkill here.

Personally I'd rather increase the service_down_time by 2.5 to accommodate the report_interval so we err on the safe side of having services showing up as online, rather than thrashing on constantly reporting in."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-12-10 15:42:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

'service_down_time' is only used by the cinder-api to assess the service status , and 'report_interval' is used by other services like cinder-volume and cinder-scheduler, so there may have different 'report_interval' config for different services, in this case, i don't think it's proper to increase 'service_down_time'."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

So I think this is a good fix, one thing I was wondering though... why not just do away with the down_time option altogether and set it based on the setting of report_interval and eliminate the issues here?

Especially if we're going to possibly change the specified setting anyway, why not just do it correctly on our own?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-12-10 17:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I like where John is going with this, but internally we have seen some issues with agent_down_time in neutron behaving differently with DB2 vs MySQL, so it seems that the backend database might play some role in how this behaves, which would leave it open to configuration by the deployer. Now that could be a misinterpretation of what's going on in Neutron, or a different bug in Neutron, or something altogether, I'm not sure, but it's something to consider here."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-12-11 02:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-11 02:38:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Make sure report_interval is less than service_down_time

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will
routinely be considered down, because they report in too rarely.
Add check for service_down_time vs report_interval, if report_interval
is larger than service_down_time, automatically change
service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5

DocImpact

Closes bug #1255685

Change-Id: I9b291669ea201321b03a48d2a132810f3bace2dc

[{'created': '2013-11-25 08:25:53.000000000', 'message': 'Support neutron configuration

commit_message:
Support neutron configuration

Since in OpenStack Havana release the Quantum project was renamed to the
Neutron, for the cookbooks we also need do the same things to support
the Neutron. I do the %s/Quantum/Neutron/g in all the files under
cookbook-openstack-netwrok. It will effect other cookbooks:
openstack-compute, openstack-ops-database which should be covered in
others patches.

Implemented: blueprint neutron-support

Change-Id: I59f3f2d8dfad678f70b97d4cbc4e10dfa163e9b2

commit_message:
Upgrade to Havana release

Also upgrade gems:
- berkshelf, ~> 2.0.10
- chefspec, ~> 3.0.2
- foodcritic, ~> 3.0.3
And update the DEPRECATION keywords

Change-Id: I8f8bf961ec065944696d4c85120aefe6c2bf76bb

commit_message:
Support neutron configuration

After we have havana branch, I search and replace all the quantum with
neturon to support neutron configuraton.
The related patch on cookbook-openstack-network is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58217/

Implemented: blueprint neutron-support

Change-Id: I0aa81b661eaa7d305d7a2645e349c893b3c849f4

commit_message:
Implement engine listener service for multi-engine support

The engine listener service provides a way for engines to confirm that
other engines are still alive.  For example, during acquisition of a
stack lock, if an existing stack lock is found the engine will attempt
to communicate with the engine who owns that lock.  If the engine
responds affirmatively, the lock will be considered active.

Blueprint multiple-engines

Change-Id: I6d8f1305953212408f19688a1e0af81c44e5e5b4

[{'created': '2013-12-12 03:56:16.000000000', 'message': "Wait for backup images to be ACTIVE in test_create_backup

The test_create_backup test creates two backup snapshot images of the
instance right away and waits for the instance to be ACTIVE before
continuing each time, and before creating the third and final backup
image.

The problem is the instance is always ACTIVE, it's the task state that
is transitioning on the instance while it's creating backup snapshot
instances and checking for old rotations to delete.

The test needs to not only check that the instance is ACTIVE before
creating each new backup but also that the snapshot image backups
themselves are ACTIVE which is a better indication that the instance's
state transition is complete.

Closes-Bug: #1257561

Change-Id: I5b423b3424e1dfe6cf5f8fef0dc9538961c1f28d

commit_message:
Wait for backup images to be ACTIVE in test_create_backup

The test_create_backup test creates two backup snapshot images of the
instance right away and waits for the instance to be ACTIVE before
continuing each time, and before creating the third and final backup
image.

The problem is the instance is always ACTIVE, it's the task state that
is transitioning on the instance while it's creating backup snapshot
instances and checking for old rotations to delete.

The test needs to not only check that the instance is ACTIVE before
creating each new backup but also that the snapshot image backups
themselves are ACTIVE which is a better indication that the instance's
state transition is complete.

Closes-Bug: #1257561

Change-Id: I5b423b3424e1dfe6cf5f8fef0dc9538961c1f28d

[{'created': '2013-12-12 02:22:04.000000000', 'message': 'Make the wait_for_server_status timeout message a bit more clear

The current error message when wait_for_server_status times out only
includes the vm_state but the method, by default, is really waiting for
a state combination of vm_state/task_state.

Sometimes the vm_state is the desired status but the task_state is not,
for example:

"Server 613b9fd8-9f3f-41a6-86cc-a36301aa7fc8 failed to reach ACTIVE
status within the required time (196 s). Current status: ACTIVE."

This patch adds the current task_state to the error message for clarity
when the timeout occurs.

Related-Bug: #1257561

Change-Id: Icfce12035bf4938eac3a13a7b640db4398ef832f

commit_message:
Make the wait_for_server_status timeout message a bit more clear

The current error message when wait_for_server_status times out only
includes the vm_state but the method, by default, is really waiting for
a state combination of vm_state/task_state.

Sometimes the vm_state is the desired status but the task_state is not,
for example:

"Server 613b9fd8-9f3f-41a6-86cc-a36301aa7fc8 failed to reach ACTIVE
status within the required time (196 s). Current status: ACTIVE."

This patch adds the current task_state to the error message for clarity
when the timeout occurs.

Related-Bug: #1257561

Change-Id: Icfce12035bf4938eac3a13a7b640db4398ef832f

commit_message:
Allow graceful shutdown on Ctrl+C

Currently it prints a stacktrace and exits. This patch makes it print
a message and exit gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1256732

Change-Id: I59ae8d09be43cd3e56dbe9bed4f6f328377dcc13

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 14:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450

[{'created': '2013-12-13 23:48:18.000000000', 'message': "don't fail on dirty logs with grenade

because grenade is upgrading from old to new we might actually
expect the logs to be dirtier than in upstream tempest. The grenade
logs weren't scrubbed in the same ways during the development here
as the tempest regular runs.

Change-Id: Id1bcc2cc85e73a414d382756a65ea1d80dc10b00
Closes-Bug: #1259907
"}]
commit_message:
don't fail on dirty logs with grenade

because grenade is upgrading from old to new we might actually
expect the logs to be dirtier than in upstream tempest. The grenade
logs weren't scrubbed in the same ways during the development here
as the tempest regular runs.

Change-Id: Id1bcc2cc85e73a414d382756a65ea1d80dc10b00
Closes-Bug: #1259907

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 14:00:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues handling trust tokens via ec2tokens API

Trust scoped tokens are handled incorectly when making requests
via the ec2tokens API, meaning that the restrictions enforced
by trust-scoped tokens are not respected when obtaining a token
via ec2token signature validation.

Storing the trust_id in the blob associated with the ec2 keypair,
and passing that id in the metadata when requesting a v2 token
solves the issue.

Change-Id: I52566384d7813ef0e2f20fb94a5076386457ff02
Closes-Bug: #1242597
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues handling trust tokens via ec2tokens API

Trust scoped tokens are handled incorectly when making requests
via the ec2tokens API, meaning that the restrictions enforced
by trust-scoped tokens are not respected when obtaining a token
via ec2token signature validation.

Storing the trust_id in the blob associated with the ec2 keypair,
and passing that id in the metadata when requesting a v2 token
solves the issue.

Change-Id: I52566384d7813ef0e2f20fb94a5076386457ff02
Closes-Bug: #1242597

The thing is that even if the instance has no image_ref it might have been booted from a volume created from an image and still keep the original image metadata. commit_message:
libvirt: Custom disk_bus setting is being lost on hard_reboot

Currently, a non-default disk_bus setting of and image will not be used,
when powering on an instance (or _hard_reboot).

hard_reboot() should use image_meta, if it exist, when constructing
the disk_info

Closes-Bug: #1255449

Change-Id: I477f69c47515ad22165421b4d23ac865c7869873

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-10 14:52:37.000000000', 'message': "Update vnc virt api to take Instance object

Update the get_vnc_console() virt api method to take an Instance object

commit_message:
Update vnc virt driver api to take Instance object

Update the get_vnc_console() virt api method to take an Instance object
instead of a dict.  No real changes were needed in the drivers to make
this work.  While we're changing the API call, add the context, as well.

Change-Id: I2026ea725d61df4b88e7618f9fd4498c62843296

[{'created': '2013-12-11 02:18:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add sleep to search_for function, so that node can be searched

When a node is bootstrapped, it takes sometime before it is searchable
through Chef. Through experimentation, we have found 300s to be a
reasonable hack for a node to be searchable. This change is no harm,
just an enhancement.

Change-Id: Id8b86dae9879d03c4a9a787833a91db666650b5c
Closes-bug: 1208201
'}]
commit_message:
Add sleep to search_for function, so that node can be searched

When a node is bootstrapped, it takes sometime before it is searchable
through Chef. Through experimentation, we have found 300s to be a
reasonable hack for a node to be searchable. This change is no harm,
just an enhancement.

Change-Id: Id8b86dae9879d03c4a9a787833a91db666650b5c
Closes-bug: 1208201

commit_message:
Add db2 support to glance on redhat platform

Add a new attribute
default["openstack"]["image"]["platform"]["db2_python_packages"]
and fix an attribute typo in registry recipe

Change-Id: I8b655bf7d861a52d0d1403c95b8a5f34274c9ef1
Implements: blueprint db2-support

[{'created': '2013-12-09 22:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Developer doc index page points to correct API docs

The index.html page of our developer web docs should now
reference the auto-generated API documentation, and we can
remove the out-of-date hand-written api-spec-v1.rst.
It served us well early on, but is impractical to keep up

commit_message:
Developer doc index page points to correct API docs

The index.html page of our developer web docs should now
reference the auto-generated API documentation, and we can
remove the out-of-date hand-written api-spec-v1.rst.
It served us well early on, but is impractical to keep up
to date with a fast-moving project.

Change-Id: Ie71f43ef363501d4c470485a011267755f41c5b3

There is an issue where the mountpoint may not be honored
so add this note to the property documentation so users can be
aware of the issue.

Change-Id: Iddab9b1f6e5fadddd00e651e92b8b9c922a59347
Closes-bug: #1231705
'}]
commit_message:
Make the mountpoint property description clearer

There is an issue where the mountpoint may not be honored
so add this note to the property documentation so users can be
aware of the issue.

Change-Id: Iddab9b1f6e5fadddd00e651e92b8b9c922a59347
Closes-bug: #1231705

commit_message:
Eradicate last of underscores in options

The --ip_range in stack.sh remains due to nova-manage needing to be fixed.

(Rebased 05Dec2013)

Change-Id: Ic0f93d41b6edfdc5deb82ae820e2c0c5a8bce24e

commit_message:
Updates README with new trove help options

Reasons:
- trove help section is an old one.

Changes:
- Updates the trove help section.
- Updates Command-line API options with the latest options.
- Updates shell.py for typos.

Closes-Bug: #1255613

Change-Id: If992d1a68a331ba50de06326b16ee86734abe52b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 22:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated REST API
documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like single-line method
doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters. For methods
that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply converts the doc string
to multi-line, so that the sphinx extension formats its output properly.

Change-Id: I0fde3314bf2d5c3e109ec85626d3e509ffd53c7c
'}, {'created': '2013-12-09 22:26:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated
REST API documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like
single-line method doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters.
For methods that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply
converts the doc string to multi-line, so that the sphinx
extension formats its output properly.

Change-Id: I0fde3314bf2d5c3e109ec85626d3e509ffd53c7c
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 01:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated
REST API documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like
single-line method doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters.

For methods that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply
converts the doc strings to multi-line, even though this does not
adhere to PEP257. This is a work-around for a bug.
  https://github.com/dreamhost/sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme/issues/8

Change-Id: I0fde3314bf2d5c3e109ec85626d3e509ffd53c7c
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 17:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated
REST API documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like
single-line method doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters.

For methods that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply
converts the doc strings to multi-line, even though this does not
adhere to PEP257. This is a work-around for a bug.
  https://github.com/dreamhost/sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme/issues/8

Change-Id: I0fde3314bf2d5c3e109ec85626d3e509ffd53c7c
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 17:44:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated
REST API documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like
single-line method doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters.

For methods that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply
converts the doc strings to multi-line, even though this does not
adhere to PEP257. This is a work-around for a bug.
  https://github.com/dreamhost/sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme/issues/8

commit_message:
Fix auto-generated REST API formatting

Fix an issue we have with the formatting of our auto-generated
REST API documentation. Sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme does not like
single-line method doc strings.

This patch adds some description of the RESTful parameters.

For methods that take no parameters (eg, get_all) it simply
converts the doc strings to multi-line, even though this does not
adhere to PEP257. This is a work-around for a bug.
  https://github.com/dreamhost/sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme/issues/8

Change-Id: I0fde3314bf2d5c3e109ec85626d3e509ffd53c7c

[{'created': '2013-12-12 01:49:21.000000000', 'message': "Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

    error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

    See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
    and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I529b53c3546754503f66822b6e15744744e1e8ab
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61164
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

    error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

    See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
    and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I529b53c3546754503f66822b6e15744744e1e8ab
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61164

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

In such case this may lead to the situation when 1 user will receive client that is authenticated as another user."}, {'account_id': 8507, 'date': '2013-12-13 20:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Alexei, if I've correctly understood your concern, that's not the case here: the osclients.Clients class is instantiated once for every user (given his credentials), and 'cache' is just an instance variable of this class. So different 'Clients' objects are responsible for different users and have different caches."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-13 21:33:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok just wanted to check :). However I cannot give it a +2 since I don't think code well enough"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-12-13 21:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Add caching to osclients.Clients

Here we add caching capabilities to the osclients.Clients class, so that any
openstack client, created once, gets stored in the cache and is immediately
returned in case of future calls to the corresponding method of Clients.
This is needed for implementing lazy OpenStack clients for temporary users
where it is not convenient to store clients in Scenario classes but making
use of caching in osclients.Clients makes sense.

Blueprint lazy-osclients

Change-Id: I5021ae0c2e11f0a27a6ea94e5a254739ddec869f

commit_message:
Add driver interfaces validation

This patch will expose a /nodes/<uuid>/validate subresource where users
could GET to trigger a validation on the 'core' and 'standardized'
interfaces for the driver the node loaded with. This will expose a way
to the ironic driver in nova to validate the driver interfaces of a node
before deploying it.

Change-Id: I1ca2b17c9752e7593214fe5b044595f6e63bed18

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix OS_AUTH_URL

Fix two places that used 127.0.0.1 as hostname instead of
controller as in the rest of the guide.

Change-Id: Ibc2bbb580c7b5c00bbed4dfa8071ca4596222d6b
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 5afb31f0c49f62c692cd1282cc48d97412fd9b50)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 17:52:17.000000000', 'message': "Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423
"}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 23:50:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove LANG=C from rootwrap invocations

For more than a decade already, systems support LC_ALL=C,
which overwrites LANG=C, so setting both is only confusing.

Change-Id: I5640b9cb747892162a856315ea7331cfea7cba5a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove LANG=C from rootwrap invocations

For more than a decade already, systems support LC_ALL=C,
which overwrites LANG=C, so setting both is only confusing.

Change-Id: I5640b9cb747892162a856315ea7331cfea7cba5a

[{'created': '2013-12-12 15:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Launch integration tests with testr

A new paramter introduced to separate unit and inegration test launch.

Change-Id: I6415e2885cae8571c0adb75216d9b11c7372462a
Fixes: bug #1259927
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 15:24:22.000000000', 'message': 'Launch integration tests with testr

A new paramter introduced to separate unit and inegration test launch.

commit_message:
Launch integration tests with testr

A new paramter introduced to separate unit and inegration test launch.
Since nosetests is not used anymore, it was removed from requirements.

Readme for integration tests updated.

Change-Id: I6415e2885cae8571c0adb75216d9b11c7372462a
Fixes: bug #1259927

[{'created': '2013-12-05 16:28:22.000000000', 'message': 'Removing vim lines

Reason:
 - python modules should be free from vim strings,
   those strings are not part of licence headers.
Changes:
 - updating all headers with header single template example

Change-Id: I675bffe015dec646dbba204c435e23fc1ecd95df
Implements: blueprint headers-clean-up
'}]
commit_message:
Removing vim lines

Reason:
 - python modules should be free from vim strings,
   those strings are not part of licence headers.
Changes:
 - updating all headers with header single template example

Change-Id: I675bffe015dec646dbba204c435e23fc1ecd95df
Implements: blueprint headers-clean-up

'}, {'created': '2013-11-28 08:40:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LibvirtGenericVIFDriver.get_config() for quota

When Nova is used with Neutron and Open vSwitch, network quotas on the
bandwidth are ignored by libvirt: the "<bandwidth>" tag is not generated in
libvirt.xml of the virtual machine. This change fixes this issue but also for
the network types: "bridge", "network" and "direct".

Commands to create the flavor with download limited to 1 MB/sec and create a
virtual machine with this flavor:
---
nova flavor-create --ephemeral=1 victor_test_vif 50 256 1 1
nova flavor-key victor_test_vif set quota:vif_inbound_average=1000
nova boot --flavor=victor_test_vif --image=cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec victor_test
---

Commands to upload a file to this virtual machine with SCP to check that the
bandwidth is limited to 1 MB/sec (replace 10.0.0.3 with the IP of the virtual
machine):
---
ip netns
sudo ip netns exec qrouter-128db593-a0db-40c3-84c7-e6383d40c75f bash

dd if=/dev/urandom of=random10MB bs=1024 count=10240
scp random10M cirros@10.0.3:
---

Change-Id: I0f0111fc79fe90900e38df022034b208f1129088
Closes-Bug: #1254664
'}]
commit_message:
Fix LibvirtGenericVIFDriver.get_config() for quota

When Nova is used with Neutron and Open vSwitch, network quotas on the
bandwidth are ignored by libvirt: the "<bandwidth>" tag is not generated in
libvirt.xml of the virtual machine. This change fixes this issue but also for
the network types: "bridge", "network" and "direct".

Commands to create the flavor with download limited to 1 MB/sec and create a
virtual machine with this flavor:
---
nova flavor-create --ephemeral=1 victor_test_vif 50 256 1 1
nova flavor-key victor_test_vif set quota:vif_inbound_average=1000
nova boot --flavor=victor_test_vif --image=cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec victor_test
---

Commands to upload a file to this virtual machine with SCP to check that the
bandwidth is limited to 1 MB/sec (replace 10.0.0.3 with the IP of the virtual
machine):
---
ip netns
sudo ip netns exec qrouter-128db593-a0db-40c3-84c7-e6383d40c75f bash

dd if=/dev/urandom of=random10MB bs=1024 count=10240
scp random10M cirros@10.0.3:
---

Change-Id: I0f0111fc79fe90900e38df022034b208f1129088
Closes-Bug: #1254664

[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:09:53.000000000', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

[{'created': '2013-12-10 20:06:16.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Cinder client mock to tests

Test cases now have a mock for the method tenant_absolute_limits
in cinder client. The absence of this mock was causing real HTTP
requests from this client.

Change-Id: I8b9c4f5affc43e2649f3ebf08580bb3d3687e09b
Closes-Bug: #1259533
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Cinder client mock to tests

Test cases now have a mock for the method tenant_absolute_limits
in cinder client. The absence of this mock was causing real HTTP
requests from this client.

Change-Id: I8b9c4f5affc43e2649f3ebf08580bb3d3687e09b
Closes-Bug: #1259533

commit_message:
Acknowledge Nova VERIFY_RESIZE as RESIZE state

After a resize, Nova changes instances to the VERIFY_RESIZE state,
which must be confirmed before they return to ACTIVE. However, as
far as Trove is concerned instances in VERIFY_RESIZE should still
report RESIZE until they're actually done. Additionally, instance
status unit tests are added to verify that the correct statuses
are reported.

Change-Id: I9c1824f8fe420025f329209c41c7aac1d8d7921c
Closes-Bug: #1217985

[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:00:15.000000000', 'message': "Return relative URIs for href-template of homedoc

Based on current implement, some href-template of homedoc
are returning absolute path ('/queues'...). It may cause

commit_message:
Return relative URIs for href-template of homedoc

Based on current implement, some href-template of homedoc
are returning absolute path ('/queues'...). It may cause
a 404 error because client may join a host with the path
directly. This patch will make sure all the href-template
start with /v1 and add unit test case to make url joining
works well.

Fixes bug 1245656

Change-Id: I12059249135cdb82be7d1937cf65db5da860011b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 16:10:17.000000000', 'message': 'Tox fails to build environment because of MySQL-Python version

  During tox building environment, it try to install the package
MySQL-python version 1.2.4 but the build failed with the error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 16, in <module>
  File "/opt/stack/nova/.tox/py27/build/MySQL-python/setup.py", line 18, in <module>
    metadata, options = get_config()
  File "setup_posix.py", line 43, in get_config
    libs = mysql_config("libs_r")
  File "setup_posix.py", line 25, in mysql_config
    raise EnvironmentError("%s not found" % (mysql_config.path,))
EnvironmentError: mysql_config not found

This patch fix the version at 1.2.3
The nova review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61955/

Change-Id: Id9e0afacee40adf101d40d076e1f5443b56523d1
'}]
commit_message:
Tox fails to build environment because of MySQL-Python version

  During tox building environment, it try to install the package
MySQL-python version 1.2.4 but the build failed with the error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 16, in <module>
  File "/opt/stack/nova/.tox/py27/build/MySQL-python/setup.py", line 18, in <module>
    metadata, options = get_config()
  File "setup_posix.py", line 43, in get_config
    libs = mysql_config("libs_r")
  File "setup_posix.py", line 25, in mysql_config
    raise EnvironmentError("%s not found" % (mysql_config.path,))
EnvironmentError: mysql_config not found

This patch fix the version at 1.2.3
The nova review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61955/

Change-Id: Id9e0afacee40adf101d40d076e1f5443b56523d1

commit_message:
Fix periodic tasks running over engine

 * Fix unit tests
 * Fix event model
 * Fix using engine module
 * Added sending signal to run workflow in events
 * Creating events when WB definition is uploaded

Change-Id: Ica7a5c0d0c367f3c7396ed1650753f1570f797b7

commit_message:
Ensure object model is loaded at correct time

Move common service startup code to solum/common/service for use
in other commands.  Object model is then loaded after configuration
is parsed so that subclasses can choose behavior based on the config,
for instance, whether the new or old schema is in place.

Change-Id: Icb692e40eaa65b545eae916bdd6c84396ea0e625

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy subclass for Application

Add an implementation package for the base object API that reuses
sqlalchemy ORM for model definition, but which provides its own
object level methods for persistence (create, save, and delete).
Most object-impls can then share common code, with a few callouts
explicitly intended to support live schema migration.

The default backend object implementation for Solum is
solum/objects/sqalchemy.

Change-Id: Icbf53ff07097e4c74c4fef155cc0bf5bc54efc18

[{'created': '2013-12-11 11:48:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add mpcut.sh for milestone-proposed branch cutting

Add an mpcut.sh script (similar to the mpdelivery.sh script) which
handles all steps required at milestone-proposed branch cutting
time in the release process:

- Creating milestone-proposed branch in gerrit
- Wait for tarball creation (calls wait_for_tarball.py)
- Set all FixCommitted bugs to FixReleased (calls process_bugs.py)

Change-Id: I417ad6247501afd7c18fdc989ae7b561c2c32814
'}]
commit_message:
Add mpcut.sh for milestone-proposed branch cutting

Add an mpcut.sh script (similar to the mpdelivery.sh script) which
handles all steps required at milestone-proposed branch cutting
time in the release process:

- Creating milestone-proposed branch in gerrit
- Wait for tarball creation (calls wait_for_tarball.py)
- Set all FixCommitted bugs to FixReleased (calls process_bugs.py)

Change-Id: I417ad6247501afd7c18fdc989ae7b561c2c32814

This reverts commit d80f30f56803acaf2fac2569af8e99d70c1d2b48.

This commit introduces a new migration script that fails to pass the
tests on MySQL (at least). This patch simply reverts it altogether until

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add a Trait Type model and db table"

This reverts commit d80f30f56803acaf2fac2569af8e99d70c1d2b48.

This commit introduces a new migration script that fails to pass the
tests on MySQL (at least). This patch simply reverts it altogether until
it's fixed.

Change-Id: Ia119f7a55637b3c13bbc28493579458c482e8693

commit_message:
glance-manage should work like nova-manage

nova-manage supports subcommands of db, for nova-manage,
eg) 'nova-manage db sync',
glance manage however has individual commands like db_sync, db_version
etc. This patch aims at adding the db operations as subcommands to db in
glance-manage similar to nova and refactoring this bit of code in
cmd/manage.py

Fixes: bug 1213197
Change-Id: I6fad31766bc1cec2a666a7ebc8df5c732007c5f1

commit_message:
Wait for nova-compute to claim to be up

Even with wait conditions, it is hard to judge from inside the
nova-compute host that nova-compute has decided it is "up".

We can poll nova service-list to know that for sure however.

Change-Id: Ibad0faa24e7d551ef5e78a2e9c1bb8f7d31fa9d1
Closes-Bug: #1260543

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-10 03:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This doesn't seem like a scenario test to me. All you're doing is listing a tenant, after creating some creds. It feels more like an API test. It turns out that we do not have an analogous identity API test for this. There is a tenants list test, but not one that checks tenants list from a non-admin user.(like you did here) I'd like to see an api test for this added instead.

I know what you're going for here with feature parity of the existing keystoneclient tests, but this just doesn't seem like a real scenario test. (yes I know the definition of that is fairly loose, but even so)

I would try to make this closer to a real workflow like the other scenario tests. You can integrate the tenant list as part of that test, but I feel like you need to do something more with the tenant to make it a scenario, maybe combine several of the keystone client tests into one scenario. (I honestly haven't looked at that code, so I'm just guessing that simulates a workflow)"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:48:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I agree this isn't a scenario test like the other tests in this directory. Is there a place in tempest for API tests? shardy put up a review to add tempest/client_lib/README.rst but that was -2 and abandoned https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51558 .

Alternatively, I could update keystone's client tests to get them acceptable for tempest scenario tests and then copy over after that."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-13 15:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I meant keystone api tests, which are independent of keystoneclient, I feel having a test that performs the operations you added here would make a good test in tempest.api.identity. I think you should do that in conjunction with making the keystoneclient tests you are trying to bring over real scenarios.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-12-13 15:17:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Abandoned

Keystone needs to update the API tests where there's a gap, and also to come up with proper scenario tests.

The v2 tests are going to go away soon enough anyway due to deprecation."}]

commit_message:
keystoneclient scenario test

We'd like to move the keystoneclient tests from Keystone to
Tempest. This is an initial copy of one of the keystoneclient
tests from keystone to a tempest scenario. Eventually, all of
Keystone's keystoneclient tests will be here.

bp keystoneclient-api

Change-Id: I6d32dda4a63376ef28457f7cba01324e59824bca

Do we want to remove this logic, or do we want the patching code to look at the version of sqlalchemy-migrate installed and decide whether to patch it? 

The global dependency still calls for 0.7.2 to be allowed, which version is actually used in the gate tests?"}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-11-21 09:00:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Doug,

1) The background is that sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.1 with wrong version '0.7.3 dev', broke the logic here, led to all tests fail, For details ,please see bug 1251700.

2)sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.2 was released after that , with modified the logic of getting verison instead of hardcode . then all the jekins build pass . That means gate tests were using latest version 0.8.2.

Though the https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L95 , that will fail when use sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.1.

 # diff sqlalchemy-migrate-  0.8.1/migrate/__init__.py sqlalchemy-migrate-0.8.2/migrate/__init__.py
  7a8,9
  > import pkg_resources
  >
  11c13,14
  < __version__ = '0.7.3.dev'
  ---
  > __version__ = pkg_resources.get_provider(
  >     pkg_resources.Requirement.parse('sqlalchemy-  migrate')).version"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-11-21 16:56:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

There's a requirements change proposed to require >= .8.2, which should eliminate the need for any older version handling.  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56662/3/global-requirements.txt

Seems like the thing to do is wait for that to merge, then wash our hands of the old broken versions?"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-11-21 16:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Ben, do we need to raise this on openstack-dev for openstack packagers to chime in?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-11-22 18:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm not sure.  I know some of them were actually calling for sqla .8 compatibility so I would expect them to be in favor of this, but I'm not sure how that's handled.  I would think the gatekeepers for global-requirements are the ones to ask about that since the version bump affects more than just Oslo."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-11-22 18:35:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I agree with Ben's idea to wait for the requirement change to land first before approving this set of changes. I think the safest thing to do is make sure this code works with both desired versions of sqlalchemy-migrate (whatever is in requirements now and 0.8.2), then update the requirements, then remove support for the old version of the library.

Does the current version of the code (without the changes proposed here) work with the 0.8.2 release of sqlalchemy-migrate?"}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-11-23 03:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Dough,
Yes, current version of the code work with 0.8.2 release of sqlalchemy-migrte , but not work with 0.8.1. But gate tests should be using 0.8.2.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-30 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Now that sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.x is available, remove the 0.7.3
patching. This allows environments to pick up 0.8.1 automatically, while
avoiding the version string error. Once an update to global-requirements
is made, another patch will pin our sqlalchemy-migrate version >= 0.8.2.

This is copied from change I646a5a8f427095e20b09fbf2db796d2644def6fc

Closes-bug: 1251700

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy-migrate 0.7.3 patching

Now that sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.x is available, remove the 0.7.3
patching. This allows environments to pick up 0.8.1 automatically,
while avoiding the version string error. Once an update to
global-requirements is made, another patch will pin our
sqlalchemy-migrate version >= 0.8.2.

This is copied from change I646a5a8f427095e20b09fbf2db796d2644def6fc

Closes-bug: 1251700
Change-Id: I51178d5b4dff56b92d2de08a73924bba56e975b6

commit_message:
Use six.moves.configparser instead of ConfigParser

The ConfigParser module has been renamed to configparser in Python 3.
See http://docs.python.org/2/library/configparser.html

Implements: blueprint make-python3-compatible
Change-Id: I13cfd5e90f1b5d342b2f3ef6dd0d246c4fda6156

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-12 01:23:24.000000000', 'message': 'Sync iso8601 requirement and fixes test case failures

1. Sync requirements from global Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
2. iso8601>=0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle date string
which only have date part like YYYY-MM-DD, it caused two Glance test
cases failure.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8160ae293383ec600c05fd2e4b38164bca7704c4)
Conflicts:
	glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py
	glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
	tools/pip-requires
'}, {'created': '2013-12-08 23:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'Sync iso8601 requirement and fixes test case failures

1. Sync requirements from global Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
2. iso8601>=0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle date string
which only have date part like YYYY-MM-DD, it caused two Glance test
cases failure.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Grizzly notice: this should fix stable/grizzly tempest failure
 error: Installed distribution iso8601 0.1.4 conflicts with requirement iso8601>=0.1.8
 at the expense of bumping version requirement for iso8601 on stable branch!

Change-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Sync iso8601 requirement and fixes test case failures

1. Sync requirements from global Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
2. iso8601>=0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle date string
which only have date part like YYYY-MM-DD, it caused two Glance test
cases failure.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Grizzly notice: this should fix stable/grizzly tempest failure
 error: Installed distribution iso8601 0.1.4 conflicts with requirement iso8601>=0.1.8
 at the expense of bumping version requirement for iso8601 on stable branch!

Also incldues: Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

Fixes bug: 1259511

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-
fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8160ae293383ec600c05fd2e4b38164bca7704c4)
Conflicts:
        glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py
        glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
        tools/pip-requires

commit_message:
This is the initial commit of the savanna puppet module.

Installs the OpenStack savanna UI and backend. Example of
use can be seen in example/example.pp

Change-Id: I3b994f70690078d37a42308f9985712e2f398924
Implements: blueprint puppet-savanna

This can't be handled in a new migration script?  What if my DB is past the 209 version?  Then I don't get this fix."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-11-25 21:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-11-25 21:21:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The bug report makes it clear that an exception would be raised if you run into the problem.

If you made it past the 209 migration without any problems, then you don't need this bug fix.

However, if you get an exception then you need this bug fix and it has to be done in the 209 migration. Creating a new migration won't fix the exception that happens in 209."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-11-25 21:33:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Johannes, thanks for the explanation, and you have it in the commit message, I was just missing it obviously:

"This can result
in an integrity violation causing the migration to fail."

I know with DB2 there is a problem in one of the migration scripts that we can't get by without fixing that one script (duplicate index name doesn't fly with DB2), so removing my score.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-25 22:06:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

I don't see any relation to my changes.

- It only failed on Python 2.7
- It fails in a different migration (152 for Postgres, 143 for MySQL) much earlier than the migration I've changed.
- It's hard to tell what the Postgres exception is because the connection is already closed. The MySQL exception is a timeout.

Everything points to this being environmental."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-12-03 20:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hmm, OK, well rather than 'recheck no bug', either find an existing bug and recheck against that or open a new bug and recheck against it. Doing 'recheck no bug' is not helpful in identifying and fixing non-deterministic check queue failures."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-12-03 21:01:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I already looked and there were no bugs reported with this failure.

From the logs and the type of failure, it looks like something got restarted. This has happened before when there have been check/gate problems. Opening a bug wouldn't help in that case since it was intended.

I'm guessing there is still some sort of problem based on the fact there still hasn't been a recheck."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-03 21:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-25 21:12:28.000000000', 'message': 'DB migration 209: Clean up child rows as well

Fixes bug 1252891

In order to add missing foreign key constraints, rows that reference a
nonexistant key need to be purged. Unfortunately, DB migration 209 does
not clean up any rows in child tables that themselves have a foreign key
constraint on the tables with the missing foreign keys. This can result
in an integrity violation causing the migration to fail.

When purging the rows, make sure to purge rows in any child tables first.

Change-Id: I25bd899383c72cb0670819b030759630ac89acaa
'}, {'created': '2013-11-25 22:44:19.000000000', 'message': 'DB migration 209: Clean up child rows as well

commit_message:
DB migration 209: Clean up child rows as well

Fixes bug 1252891

In order to add missing foreign key constraints, rows that reference a
nonexistant key need to be purged. Unfortunately, DB migration 209 does
not clean up any rows in child tables that themselves have a foreign key
constraint on the tables with the missing foreign keys. This can result
in an integrity violation causing the migration to fail.

When purging the rows, make sure to purge rows in any child tables first.

Change-Id: I25bd899383c72cb0670819b030759630ac89acaa

commit_message:
Add ceph::repo RedHat support

Adds repo's required to support RedHat distros.
Update case tests so RedHat doesn't fail.

Sourced from: https://github.com/Mirantis/fuel/blob/master/deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/yum.pp

System spec tests will be provided in a follow up commit
repos are from a working deployment and are tested by hand.

Closes-bug: #1243872
Change-Id: I6d9e356bac6855fd30c522916bf7c4867195488c

Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use ensure_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/#/c/61737/

commit_message:
Remove obsolete options for qpid reconnect.

Qpid reconnect options were removed from oslo.

b2facb4f4ff2ee75366ec9e51dd59eede5bbb47d

Change-Id: I372c9358d9ae2628e3403fb817823aa4e38dea76

commit_message:
Add IPAddress field type

This will allow either a v4 or v6 IP address.

Introduce 'ip' synonym for 'netaddr.IPAddress' to tests, for
readability.

This is part of: blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I6a7c8f0924f524d1dbf8071bb553c2e9be912894

[{'created': '2013-12-13 14:06:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix check for overcloud compute hostname

The overcloud compute hostname is actually overcloud-novacompute0-xxxxx,
so the extra dash here was failing the check.  This should hopefully
resolve the latest CD cloud failure.

Change-Id: I6dace6a34b79170a88aa571141bb3cb52ba08027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check for overcloud compute hostname

The overcloud compute hostname is actually overcloud-novacompute0-xxxxx,
so the extra dash here was failing the check.  This should hopefully
resolve the latest CD cloud failure.

Change-Id: I6dace6a34b79170a88aa571141bb3cb52ba08027

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 22:29:39.000000000', 'message': 'Log exception in _heal_instance_info_cache

Previously, if errors occurred in _heal_instance_info_cache() they would
go unnoticed as their log level was debug and the stace trace was not
displayed. This patch changes that so the exception is logged so periodic
failures here can be more easily detected and fixed.

Change-Id: I15bb3e7e29462e930f6159be9f4bbf4980b1270c
Closes-bug: #1257940
'}, {'created': '2013-12-04 22:35:59.000000000', 'message': 'Log exception in _heal_instance_info_cache

Previously, if errors occurred in _heal_instance_info_cache() they would
go unnoticed as their log level was debug and the stace trace was not
displayed. This patch changes that so the exception is logged so periodic
failures here can be more easily detected and fixed.

Change-Id: I15bb3e7e29462e930f6159be9f4bbf4980b1270c
Closes-bug: #1257940
'}, {'created': '2013-12-04 22:42:24.000000000', 'message': 'Log exception in _heal_instance_info_cache

Previously, if errors occurred in _heal_instance_info_cache() they would
go unnoticed as their log level was debug and the stace trace was not
displayed. This patch changes that so the exception is logged so periodic
failures here can be more easily detected and fixed.

commit_message:
Log exception in _heal_instance_info_cache

Previously, if errors occurred in _heal_instance_info_cache() they would
go unnoticed as their log level was debug and the stace trace was not
displayed. This patch changes that so the exception is logged so periodic
failures here can be more easily detected and fixed.

Change-Id: I15bb3e7e29462e930f6159be9f4bbf4980b1270c
Closes-bug: #1257940

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 20:00:56.000000000', 'message': 'Lazy log the fixed_key warnings

Cinder currently spews quite a bit of WARNINGs like this with
the default settings:

WARNING cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr [-] config option keymgr.fixed_key
has not been defined: some operations may fail unexpectedly

Many users may not be using features that require key manager...
so logging the WARNING message a bit more lazily seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I5ab72285c7d4bc2ec3196dd94fabf977b3a4ebaf
Closes-bug: 1252512
'}]
commit_message:
Lazy log the fixed_key warnings

Cinder currently spews quite a bit of WARNINGs like this with
the default settings:

WARNING cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr [-] config option keymgr.fixed_key
has not been defined: some operations may fail unexpectedly

Many users may not be using features that require key manager...
so logging the WARNING message a bit more lazily seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I5ab72285c7d4bc2ec3196dd94fabf977b3a4ebaf
Closes-bug: 1252512

This is suitable enough for a first version. We should include more complete documentation in the README with how dos.py works.'}, {'account_id': 406, 'date': '2013-12-12 16:03:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It would be suitable enough for a first version if you at least specify what we use it for. Such things as:
* test OpenStack deployments on distributed environments, currently emulated by KVM VMs, with WIP for bare-metal driver
* with such a functionality as:
  - booting from ISO
  - booting over PXE
  - allow to create multiple NICs with ability to set NIC type
  - allow to create arbitrary disk configurations"}, {'account_id': 8965, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8965, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

subject: Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1918, 'name': 'Franois Charlier', 'email': 'francois.charlier@redhat.com', 'username': 'francois-charlier'}, {'_account_id': 6754, 'name': 'Mark T. [{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

- gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.1 http://logs.openstack.org/37/61737/1/check/gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.1/2808a8d : SUCCESS in 1m 25s
- gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.2 http://logs.openstack.org/37/61737/1/check/gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.2/7f9bb0b : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.3 http://logs.openstack.org/37/61737/1/check/gate-puppet-neutron-puppet-unit-3.3/7929512 : SUCCESS in 1m 31s
'}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1918, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This won't work either, this will generate another error: 

  $ cat lala.pp 
  package { 'dnsmasq': ensure => present }

  ensure_resource ( 'package', 'dnsmasq-neutron', { ensure => present, name => 'dnsmasq' } )

  $ sudo puppet apply lala.pp
  Error: Cannot alias Package[dnsmasq-neutron] to ["dnsmasq"]; resource ["Package", "dnsmasq"] already declared at /home/naz/lala.pp:1 at /home/naz/lala.pp:3 on node andouille.enovance.com
  Wrapped exception:
  Cannot alias Package[dnsmasq-neutron] to ["dnsmasq"]; resource ["Package", "dnsmasq"] already declared at /home/naz/lala.pp:1
  Error: Cannot alias Package[dnsmasq-neutron] to ["dnsmasq"]; resource ["Package", "dnsmasq"] already declared at /home/naz/lala.pp:1 at /home/naz/lala.pp:3 on node andouille.enovance.com'}, {'account_id': 1918, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You should rather use ensure_packages in this case'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:59:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ensure package didn't work because the resource names are the same but the actual packages referenced by those identical names are different

renaming the resources on both sides to reflect that they're different gets it correct

puppet-cobbler has a resource called dnsmasq which installs dnsmasq

I've renamed that to dnsmasq-cobbler

now with this pull puppet-neutron will have a resource called dnsmasq-neutron which installs dnsmasq-base and dnsmasq-utils"}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Did you test what happens in the RHEL case, where it does actually install dnsmasq?'}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:18:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this should be:

in neutron:

ensure_packages($neutron::params::dnsmasq_packages)

in cobbler:

ensure_packages('dnsmasq')

I have tested this locally and it seems ok. Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:19:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

except in cobbler it's a list - ensure_packages(['dnsmasq'])"}, {'account_id': 1918, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Chris, could you provide a minimal example using ensure_packages that would fail ? (or ping me on irc to discuss this: fc__ ) Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:29:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Doing ensure_packages at the Package[dnsmasq] resource level didn't work right because Package[dnsmasq] is really different between the two

Trying Michael's suggestion of doing at the actual package name level now... I suspect that'll work. If so I'll redo this patch that way"}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-12-12 19:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-12 19:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 13:28:34.000000000', 'message': 'Rename dnsmasq package resource

Rename dnsmasq package resource to allow coexistance with other modules
which define the same resource name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Change-Id: Id4cb8b4fdf291f3a62682ab5655ac4eaf2a5370b
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 19:12:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use enable_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use enable_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

commit_message:
Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use ensure_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Change-Id: Id4cb8b4fdf291f3a62682ab5655ac4eaf2a5370b

commit_message:
Cleaning __init__.py from headers

Reason:
 - all __init__.py without any logic should be free from headers

Implements: blueprint headers-clean-up
Change-Id: Ic5856ff23c1a94425b923f6605d2483f072c07ba

commit_message:
Provisioning via Heat

A work in progress change. Seems like basic provisioning, scaling,
adding floating IPs, cinder volumes, rollback works.

Heat Template for Hadoop cluster now looks as is follows:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/54693/

TODOs which will be done in separate CRs:
 * Extract common part of instances.py and instances_heat.py
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259170
 * Add Anti-Affinity feature to Heat engine
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259172
 * Add Nova Network support
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259176
 * Add more unit tests to heat engine
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259174
 * Make sure CI works with the Heat engine turned on
   (Not CR for that, will be done manually soon)

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Ignatov <aignatov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I679ad4afa9f27c3c9ea69ac046a5629a11d6e190

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 12:32:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wait for Neutron L2 Agent

A recent commit adds a wait for the Neutron L2 agent to be ready before
continuing with devtest. wait_for seem to have trouble with the way the
quotes are escaped. This commit changes them to wildcards instead.

The check was also waiting for the agent on the notcompute node,
according to the commit message the compute node was what was
intended(which makes more sense), this commit also changes the
check to wait for the agent on compute.

Change-Id: I231cde6263dd193767989f65b87162cf96a2803c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wait for Neutron L2 Agent

A recent commit adds a wait for the Neutron L2 agent to be ready before
continuing with devtest. wait_for seem to have trouble with the way the
quotes are escaped. This commit changes them to wildcards instead.

The check was also waiting for the agent on the notcompute node,
according to the commit message the compute node was what was
intended(which makes more sense), this commit also changes the
check to wait for the agent on compute.

Change-Id: I231cde6263dd193767989f65b87162cf96a2803c

I noticed tempest failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1253896

We don't automatically recheck or reverify, so please consider
doing that manually if someone hasn't already. For a code review
which is not yet approved, you can recheck by leaving a code
review comment with just the text:

    recheck bug 1253896

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(A in B) to assertIn(A, B)

The code in tests was using assertTrue(A in B) and similar
instead of assertIn / assertNotIn.

assertIn / assertNotIn assertions are provided by `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6.

Closes-Bug: #1259295

Change-Id: Ibf3b0c7f27895699db8a13bf6e1640d196f1a953

commit_message:
Quoting attachment filename

Attachment file name was not surrounded by quotes.
If an attachment was "picture of me.png", the browser was proposing to
download a file named "picture".

Change-Id: I17a1f8ca3b7ef44171c4977bacc9045e4695e18c
Closes-bug: #1245927

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-13 18:57:02.000000000', 'message': "Update Instance with deleted_at from database

In cases where Nova falls back to simply locally deleting an
instance, the Instance object was not updated with the deleted_at
generated by the database implementation. Due to this, the
notification emitted to signify that the delete finished was
getting emitted without a deleted_at value.

This change uses the result from the instance_destroy call to
set the deleted_at value on the Instance so that it's available
for the compute.instance.delete.end notification.

Change-Id: I55ed37cf89dd6eb8ea901c6f813191a0ce1058e8
Closes-Bug: #1250206

commit_message:
Update Instance from database after destroy

In cases where Nova falls back to simply locally deleting an
instance, the Instance object was not updated with the deleted_at
generated by the database implementation. Due to this, the
notification emitted to signify that the delete finished was
getting emitted without a deleted_at value.

This change uses the result from the instance_destroy call to
update the Instance object with the latest state from the database.
Thus, the compute.instance.delete.end notification is emitted
with the proper deleted_at value.

Closes-Bug: #1250206
Change-Id: I55ed37cf89dd6eb8ea901c6f813191a0ce1058e8

commit_message:
Benchmark scenarios for Rally: Nova rescue server

The patch providers Rally with the basic Nova benchmark scenario for
rescue/unrescue server:these include rescue and unrescue server.

Blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: Ic764fd7addc5824d94c93dcae455037e14de95e0

[{'created': '2013-12-04 23:14:08.000000000', 'message': "Try decoding string to UTF-8 on error message fail

Database Errors from SQLAlchemy tend to get mangled into ASCII. If an
error is process that contains UTF-8 data in ASCII form if fails to
build the message and will lead to a 5xx error. Catch the error and try
to decode it to create the message again, if that doesn't work at least
fail gracefully.

Closes-Bug: 1253905
Change-Id: I1865b01f57f5c277a70085e9bad5697f5ceafad1
(cherry picked from commit dcefe5874de3073551226c0bdd1e70f00d6a91a1)
"}, {'created': '2013-12-05 23:56:50.000000000', 'message': "Try decoding string to UTF-8 on error message fail

Database Errors from SQLAlchemy tend to get mangled into ASCII. If an
error is process that contains UTF-8 data in ASCII form if fails to
build the message and will lead to a 5xx error. Catch the error and try
to decode it to create the message again, if that doesn't work at least
fail gracefully.

Closes-Bug: 1253905
Change-Id: I1865b01f57f5c277a70085e9bad5697f5ceafad1
(cherry picked from commit dcefe5874de3073551226c0bdd1e70f00d6a91a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Try decoding string to UTF-8 on error message fail

Database Errors from SQLAlchemy tend to get mangled into ASCII. If an
error is process that contains UTF-8 data in ASCII form if fails to
build the message and will lead to a 5xx error. Catch the error and try
to decode it to create the message again, if that doesn't work at least
fail gracefully.

Closes-Bug: 1253905
Change-Id: I1865b01f57f5c277a70085e9bad5697f5ceafad1
(cherry picked from commit dcefe5874de3073551226c0bdd1e70f00d6a91a1)

Creating the "_member_" role and "Member" role creates confusion.

'}]
commit_message:
Don't create Member role

Creating the "_member_" role and "Member" role creates confusion.
"_member_" has special significance to keystone, so we keep that.

Horizon is modified to use "_member_" as the default role in [1].
This change should be merged after that.

See also rhbz#984294 [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60462/
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=984294

Change-Id: If4ed1c2c72ca67acad7b70651e68ff7ce68157dd

commit_message:
api call error forwarding to cli

* prints api call error along with http error
* checks for empty error response body

Closes-bug: #1259585

Change-Id: I332fa960d74681610e6cf6b759c9b6bd5f91ec91

commit_message:
Add support for resource_types

This adds the following commands:
$ heat resource-type-list
$ heat resource-type-show <resource type>

Change-Id: Ifa70da5bc56a5f2979697a9ce2c41fa9a5c1f947
Closes-bug: #1260130

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-23 02:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Return an exit code for configuration errors

Red Hat's QA noticed that in case of the infamous "xattr>=0.4"
error, swift-init exits with a zero error code, which confuses
startup scripts (not Systemd though -- that one knows exactly
if processes run or not).

The easiest fix is to return the error code like Guido's blog
post suggested.

Change-Id: I7badd8742375a7cb2aa5606277316477b8083f8d
Fixes: rhbz#1020480
'}]
commit_message:
Return an exit code for configuration errors

Red Hat's QA noticed that in case of the infamous "xattr>=0.4"
error, swift-init exits with a zero error code, which confuses
startup scripts (not Systemd though -- that one knows exactly
if processes run or not).

The easiest fix is to return the error code like Guido's blog
post suggested.

Change-Id: I7badd8742375a7cb2aa5606277316477b8083f8d
Fixes: rhbz#1020480

[{'created': '2013-11-29 04:04:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unstable test which gets console output

The previous test "test_get_console_output" executes an instance reboot,
so both behaviors are almost same. In addition, we don't necessarily get
"REBOOT" state of an instance because the state is ephemeral.
This patch removes such unstable test.

Closes-Bug: #1014683
Change-Id: I4b06b148b5d9bceda0cef2d2bb5f3b72325928ac

commit_message:
Change unstable test which gets console output

We don't necessarily get "REBOOT" status of a server because the
state is ephemeral. As the result, the test fails sometimes.
This patch changes the server status from "REBOOT" to "SHUTOFF" for
stable test condition.

Closes-Bug: #1014683
Change-Id: I4b06b148b5d9bceda0cef2d2bb5f3b72325928ac

commit_message:
Fix simple-db image filtering on extra properties

This fixes a bug in simple DB that causes filtering of images based on
extra-properties to fail. The current code works only when an image has no
extra-properties or exactly one. The current test suite doesn't include a test
that tries to filter images based on more than one extra-property.

Also, added both functional and unit tests to test image list with filters
using more than one extra-property.

Fixes bug: 1259227
Change-Id: I4c0d294585235dacbf154bf0df5d1e7c4a172cdd

alignment with project standards.

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I0b2da3369ec303b9997305f602e6c444cafe14b0

commit_message:
Remove generic_setup_package() function

The generic_setup_package() function was previously run at init which
was causing a dependency on a config when a file was imported. This
commit takes that functionality and puts it in a classmethod and calls
that in setUpClass. There was nothing in generic_setup_package() that
needed to be run during so init, so this moves it to the proper place.

Change-Id: I32fa0fb1e230a98a3a9ca732df2d013ca4f13dce

commit_message:
Add some tests to demonstrate hash_cleanup_listdir

We add some tests to verify various behaviors of
hash_cleanup_listdir(), and break them into individual tests so that
one failure won't prevent the others from running as well.

Change-Id: I4f52388d813f061b8e7d2b45dfb0f805689020c2

commit_message:
Add assertSetEqual to base test class

Implement and add assertSetEqual to the base test class so that the
functionaly of set-specific comparison can be used in python 2.6.
Once python 2.6 support is deprecated completly, this new method
can be deleted and the tests will fall back onto the upstream version
of this test.  This is a copy of the method implemented on the TestCase
super class in python 2.7 with minor changes to conform to OpenStack
Hacking.

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I76a7d9a10b30ed6b0ac0aef4e5dd522cafb321e2

commit_message:
Don't replace instance.info_cache on each save

If we are working on an Instance that came from an older client,
we should not replace an older nested .info_cache object with a
newer one for no reason during a save().

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I8cf4a629d454de1a5de16ea4032f39e36aab505a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-13 09:37:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove useless statement which is a performance bottleneck

The statement makes no change to a list of volumes items, but causes
cinder volume list api response reduced 10 times for a user with 1000
volumes.

Change-Id: I8d915d16368a38ff00f2aee54d2a9ff32e45647c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove useless statement which is a performance bottleneck

The statement makes no change to a list of volumes items, but causes
cinder volume list api response reduced 10 times for a user with 1000
volumes.

Change-Id: I8d915d16368a38ff00f2aee54d2a9ff32e45647c

commit_message:
Add ABCMeta metaclass to token provider

Use the abc module for managing abstract base classes in the driver
layer.

bp: abstract-base-class-drivers

Wait for node online status

commit_message:
Tempest test for python troveclient

Implements the tests for following commands:
1. Flavor show
2. Instance list
3. Create Instance
4. Delete instance
4. Database create
4. Database list.

Change-Id: Ib406650ea755425337642c868f5d19989b6cf246
Implements: blueprint add-python-troveclient-tests

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-29 06:36:39.000000000', 'message': "Base Implementation of KVS Dogpile Refactor

This changeset implements a KVS interface that makes use of
dogpile's backends.  Included is an in-memory database (primarily
to be used for testing) that isolates data from modification via
liberal use of copy.deepcopy.  The memcached backend is a manager
pivot to allow the use of the various dogpile.cache memcache
backends while maintaining a simplified interface.

The KVS system implements a Distributed-Capable locking system that
hooks into the dogpile.cache backend mutexes.  A global toggle has
been added to enable/disable locking across all KVS backends.

The scafolding for the use of the keystoneclient implemented
memcache_crypt has also been applied across the top-level KVS
interface.  The memcache_crypt is completely optional, and will
not impact any aspect of the operation unless the KVSBase
instantiation is explicitly configured to use it.

The original kvs implementation has been moved to
keystone.common.kvs.legacy.  For compatibility all elements of the
old keystone.common.kvs namespace have been made available at
keystone.common.kvs.  The legacy kvs implementation has been marked
for deprecation after the release of ICEHOUSE.

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I8af1adfcb181f9118a1f21aada2e000c6cc0c201

commit_message:
Base Implementation of KVS Dogpile Refactor

This changeset implements a KVS interface that makes use of
dogpile's backends.  Included is an in-memory database (primarily
to be used for testing) that isolates data from modification via
liberal use of copy.deepcopy.  The memcached backend is a manager
pivot to allow the use of the various dogpile.cache memcache
backends while maintaining a simplified interface.

The KVS system implements a Distributed-Capable locking system that
hooks into the dogpile.cache backend mutexes. Locking can be
toggled at configuration time for a given KeyValueStore
instantiation.

The original kvs implementation has been moved to
keystone.common.kvs.legacy.  For compatibility all elements of the
old keystone.common.kvs namespace have been made available at
keystone.common.kvs.  The legacy kvs implementation has been marked
for deprecation after the release of ICEHOUSE.

DocImpact

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I8af1adfcb181f9118a1f21aada2e000c6cc0c201

commit_message:
Add validation for an existence of a resource type

Validation of resource type existence was missing.
The patch adds validation checks that in the template the resource
type is set and is not an empty string.

Change-Id: I171644010ec868e8acc4c29556889256e8bf51b6
Closes-Bug: #1257243

commit_message:
XenAPI: Synchronize on all VBD plug/unplug per VM

Dynamically adding or removing a device needs to be synchronized
to work around a bug in XenServer 6.1 and 6.2 where simultaneous
events can be partially ignored, leading to a failure to plug or
unplug.  The bug is between two internal components in XenServer
which pass messages - the first component will ignore all messages
from the second while a plug/unplug is in progress, expecting
only one message to be received.  If two plug/unplugs occur in
this time, an internal assertion is raised as XAPIs internal state
is inconsistent.

Change I7b86325714e38b00a2f51bbf083b5532a6c51fa9 attempted to
work around the issue by retrying - however that does not catch
all failures.  This change should eliminate some of the known
INTERNAL_ERROR failures, but not all, so I7b8 need not be
reverted.

Change Ie7a64c481a9e3874df9d5924fbb050ac7ab117db does the same
as this, but only for VBD.plug.

Change-Id: If78d4e5f1dd84f1d4a588f25b8f887a7b125bbea
Closes-bug: 1217972

commit_message:
Fix the upper values of test_network_quotas

In test_network_quotas scenario test, hard-coded values are used as
upper value.
These should be the actual quota values.

Change-Id: Ief1b12e13d0a191f2db78540d249c72c0dcc7d19
Closes-Bug: #1252999

subject: Change retry to attempt for retry filter logic
messages: [{'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-12-13 07:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-12-13 07:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-12-13 07:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this\n\nLike I mentioned in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61003/, changing the key in RPC message payload like this will break if old scheduler and new scheduler work in the same environment (typical rolling upgrade scenario)."}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-12-13 08:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Change retry to attempt for retry filter logic

After patch of Ia355810b106fee14a55f48081301a310979befac, retry
filter was renamed to IgnoreAttemptedHostsFilter and its variable
retry was changed to attempt, so it is better to update nova scheduler
and nova compute logic by replace retry to attempt.

This can make sure once nova using filters from oslo, there is no need
to change retry logic.

Change-Id: I801c89352e451f6ce45531fd1a358f41b848d20e
Closes-Bug: #1260588

commit_message:
Adding an option to use qpid instead of rabbit or zeromq

Patch 1/2 rabbit and zeromq doesn't work very well on
power, and there's no option to pass to Jenkins to use
qpid (which works fine on power)

Change-Id: Iaf2dc45130e525bf3e2e23395e5e7c8c9fa29e1b
