commit_message:
Replace startswith by more precise store matching

Currently a source is considered valid if it only starts with a specific set
of word. For example swift is a valid location scheme, so is swiftpe or
swiftopenstack with the current implementation. This commit compare the scheme
of the location - all of it - to a given set of supported schemes

Change-Id: Ie827c3c3f36fbf958a1270039cab28d4c5fc4fe1
Closes-Bug: #1257496

'}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-11-13 16:05:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't like that the in-memory cache (self.devices in agent_manager) is being brought up to the top level.  This cache makes sense for the haproxy driver, and other exec based drivers that need to track local resources on the local machine.

It makes it harder to scale agents that will be communicating over an API, such as F5 or stingray loadbalancers.  These should be able to retrieve the current and desired state of resources when a change is requested, and either coordinate among themselves about who is currently making a change, or have the scheduler or config select among them for who is currently tasked with managing a given loadbalancer.

Some notes on https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/multiple_LBaaS_agents"}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-11-15 10:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: No score

"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-11-21 15:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

The code quality looks good.

However, this patch is bumping the major version of RPC and it means lbaas agent and neutron-server cannot communicate during upgrade.
It should be discussed from the point of project management view in dev ML or IRC meeting. We need to check RPC major version bumping policy in Neutron and OpenStack projects. I put -1 temporarily.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-11-21 15:39:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-11-21 16:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

I talked with Mark. Bumping major RPC version is ok because datapath is not affected during upgrade. We need to note upgrade steps or server-agent communication will fail until both sides are upgrade in the release note. Could you add DocImpact flag and what happens during upgrade in the commit message. This is the only reason of -1 now.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-11-22 09:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-22 10:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Works for me

commit_message:
Use a dictionary to eliminate the inner loop in _choose_host_filters()

it looks like an o(n) algorithm, we can use a dictionary to eliminate
the inner loop.

Change-Id: I32747120ae1f2f1bc0a3810a03e0cd9baa7a8d2c

Allow commit title messages to end with a period.

Match what we have in keystone (http://git.io/BNnRcw)

Closes-Bug: 1259488
Change-Id: I6baa0504b9df1f5094df1249d7d902f2188fd95a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 13:38:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues handling trust tokens via ec2tokens API

Trust scoped tokens are handled incorectly when making requests
via the ec2tokens API, meaning that the restrictions enforced
by trust-scoped tokens are not respected when obtaining a token
via ec2token signature validation.

Storing the trust_id in the blob associated with the ec2 keypair,
and passing that id in the metadata when requesting a v2 token
solves the issue.

Change-Id: I52566384d7813ef0e2f20fb94a5076386457ff02
Closes-Bug: #1242597
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues handling trust tokens via ec2tokens API

Trust scoped tokens are handled incorectly when making requests
via the ec2tokens API, meaning that the restrictions enforced
by trust-scoped tokens are not respected when obtaining a token
via ec2token signature validation.

Storing the trust_id in the blob associated with the ec2 keypair,
and passing that id in the metadata when requesting a v2 token
solves the issue.

Change-Id: I52566384d7813ef0e2f20fb94a5076386457ff02
Closes-Bug: #1242597

Per-project rootwraps (cinder-rootwrap, nova-rootwrap, neutron-rootwrap)
are being replaced by the common oslo-rootwrap (oslo.rootwrap package).

commit_message:
Add oslo.rootwrap to global requirements

Per-project rootwraps (cinder-rootwrap, nova-rootwrap, neutron-rootwrap)
are being replaced by the common oslo-rootwrap (oslo.rootwrap package).

As a first step in the migration, oslo.rootwrap needs to get installed
as a runtime dependency.

Change-Id: I90d5ca8504855edac8a09492203100ba7f708d80

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-28 16:44:57.000000000', 'message': 'Provide guest_info per datastore

Reason:
- Trove configs holding more then one options for different datastores,
best way to simplify main config is to externalize config per datastore,
which would handle datastore specific parameters
Changes:
- Changing scripts for guest launch
- Adding stack post-install hooks
  (copying trove-guestagent.conf.sample into /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf)

Change-Id: I87d3c1bf27e71fa5297b77204bbe1cd996c9d517
Implements: blueprint template-config-per-datastore
'}]
commit_message:
Provide guest_info per datastore

Reason:
- Trove configs holding more then one options for different datastores,
best way to simplify main config is to externalize config per datastore,
which would handle datastore specific parameters
Changes:
- Changing scripts for guest launch
- Adding stack post-install hooks
  (copying trove-guestagent.conf.sample into /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf)

Change-Id: I87d3c1bf27e71fa5297b77204bbe1cd996c9d517
Implements: blueprint template-config-per-datastore

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 15:53:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug with no test status updating while standalone run.

Sometimes when single test from testrun is started or restarted its
status is not updated by nose storage plugin. In those conditions
session from nose storage plugin can not access data that were provided
by session of higher level in models.py logic of parent process.
Explicitly closing parent process session before start test running
does help but some additional code modification required in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie5415963c189b66cca58986370982f814f2a7431
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug with no test status updating while standalone run.

Sometimes when single test from testrun is started or restarted its
status is not updated by nose storage plugin. In those conditions
session from nose storage plugin can not access data that were provided
by session of higher level in models.py logic of parent process.
Explicitly closing parent process session before start test running
does help but some additional code modification required in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie5415963c189b66cca58986370982f814f2a7431

commit_message:
Added flavor creation to heatmanager.py.

Own flavor is needed for successful stack creation in parallel with other tests.
Fixes bug: 1257666

Change-Id: Ia942e75ba4b80eb541e82e4f73c5d5026be68cc6

commit_message:
Test db2 disconnect with real db2 dialect

It will be a more usefull test to use the real db2
dialect.is_disconnect function logic to make sure
there is not regresssions in that area. Will need
ibm_db_sa to be included in test framework first.

Depends on change I7f91ab1978399f6dcabc76c939be54746db14620

Change-Id: I220d240809bb8dc0b3b5fef9fe4827d9fc50fe10

commit_message:
Specify NetID for environment with several networks

Add a new flag to specify on which network the DB instance
should be connected to

Change-Id: I7e65af21cfd4f4a84804819162189221742626d1
Closes-Bug: #1257838

commit_message:
Python3: Use six.StringIO for io.Bytes()

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO which
is a fake file object for textual data. It's an alias for StringIO.StringIO
in python2 and io.StringIO in Python3.

Use the fake object where approiate.

Change-Id: Ie4b812024336dbbcef5aa5446c2a5751dd90f7e8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 3

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

Add new base class for tests which need to set
property protections. Inherit StoreClearingUnitTest,
IsolatedUnitTest and UsingPolicyFileMixinTest
from it.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-02 21:12:24.000000000', 'message': "Avoid concurrent creation of the same network.

The DHCP agent will happily run multiple creation operations for a
network at the same time. Unfortunately they are not aware of each other
and can cause all sorts of issues. Deletion of a network while it is
also being created is a possibility as well.

This patch also includes some alterations of code that seems to often be
called after things have been deleted that are assumed to still be
around. This is causing a few unexpected exceptions and messing up
cleanup in several cases.

This commit message will need to be amended if it is an appropriate fix
because I really don't know how many bugs this will address at the
moment... except that is likely more than one.

Change-Id: I0dde9ddc5dcadde921b9db80439513fe6496fb45
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid concurrent creation of the same network.

The DHCP agent will happily run multiple creation operations for a
network at the same time. Unfortunately they are not aware of each other
and can cause all sorts of issues. Deletion of a network while it is
also being created is a possibility as well.

This patch also includes some alterations of code that seems to often be
called after things have been deleted that are assumed to still be
around. This is causing a few unexpected exceptions and messing up
cleanup in several cases.

This commit message will need to be amended if it is an appropriate fix
because I really don't know how many bugs this will address at the
moment... except that is likely more than one.

Change-Id: I0dde9ddc5dcadde921b9db80439513fe6496fb45

The default region name "regionOne" is different with most others

Modified the default region name in some places from "regionOne" to "RegionOne"

Fixes bug #1252992

commit_message:
"PrivateDnsName" returns physical resource name

Attributes "PrivateDnsName" and "PublicDnsName" return physical
resource name for resource AWS::EC2::Instance.

Change-Id: I21dea02241a56e02516c40d86e6b82a926226d74
Closes-Bug: #1245545

commit_message:
Replaces call to lvs with blockdev.

Replaces the call to lvs in virt/libvirt/utils.py:logical_volume_size()
with the more general blockdev.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-ephemeral-storage
Change-Id: I3e4e4e927a98fa9e396618e45ac01cc836a75988

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-07 16:26:52.000000000', 'message': "Add shutdown option to cleanup running periodic

Add a 'shutdown' option to the periodic task that cleans up instances
that are both deleted *and* running.

The option provides powers down instances and marks them as
non-bootable.  This is a flag for system administrators who would like
to have reclaim the resources consumed by the instance, but leave the
record around for later examination/debugging.

Change-Id: Id95845eb995b62ed8858fe61c6fdb34045721674
"}, {'created': '2013-11-07 20:04:47.000000000', 'message': "Add shutdown option to cleanup running periodic

Add a 'shutdown' option to the periodic task that cleans up instances
that are both deleted *and* running.

The option provides powers down instances and marks them as

commit_message:
Add shutdown option to cleanup running periodic

Add a 'shutdown' option to the periodic task that cleans up instances
which are both deleted *and* running.

The option powers down instances and marks them as non-bootable.  This
is a flag for system administrators who would like to reclaim the
resources consumed by each instance, but leave the records around for
later examination/debugging.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint cleanup-running-deleted-shutdown

Change-Id: Id95845eb995b62ed8858fe61c6fdb34045721674

commit_message:
Enforce metadata string type on key/value pairs

The compute API is currently enforcing quota limits for user metadata
and length restrictions on the dict entries, but is not enforcing that
they are string types. This patch adds the checks for string type on the
keys and values in the metadata dict.

Closes-Bug: #1240319

Change-Id: Ic4aacc342cf37d929871287e6e4917f4f48b63e8

"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-12-04 09:52:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can you explain the justification for this being a periodic task in keystone, rather than e.g a one-line cron job calling keystone-manage token_flush?

Interested in the pros/cons here, but in Heat, we have found periodic tasks in our code to be evil and limit scalability, so we prefer to have either a *-manage flush command, or in future an admin API call to prompt purging deleted items.

This requirement for flushing deleted stuff is common over many openstack projects, so this could warrant some ML discussion so we can align with a solution which works for all projects."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-12 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-12 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Periodically flush expired tokens

Add a configuration option to enable automatic deletion of expired
tokens.

Implements: blueprint keystone-manage-token-flush-periodically

Change-Id: I697e41f7590855320cb82403201de74157a2a186

We don't automatically recheck or reverify, so please consider
doing that manually if someone hasn't already. For a code review
which is not yet approved, you can recheck by leaving a code
review comment with just the text:

    recheck bug 1253896

For a code review which has been approved but failed to merge,
you can reverify by leaving a comment like this:

commit_message:
service: fix service alive checking

This change the way we check for service being alive in a more portable
way by using os.kill() with a null signal.

Change-Id: I588ab19de15b351c1de3ab28b8655e400b2a2064

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Well done, I hope this gets in! I'll test using heat's in-instance metric collector (https://github.com/openstack/heat-cfntools/blob/master/bin/cfn-push-stats). At first glance one  of the awkward things is knowing which Dimension to take as the "resource_id". We can't control the ordering (at least if using the boto client) so it might make sense try some obvious good guesses:
 1) look at the most common metrics used for each namespace
 2) see what we tend to store in ceilometer

 see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/CW_Support_For_AWS.html

 I'd try some common dimensions like if namespace == "AWS/EC2" then try find "InstanceId"'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-30 07:06:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I had a quick try with heat-watch (heat's cw cli) https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/cfn_client/boto_client_cloudwatch.py and realized you have no aws auth. I think you need something like: https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/api/aws/ec2token.py (as middleware)

 I did the following:
 keystone ec2-credentials-list
 (copied the access and key)
 vim ~/.boto
 [Credentials]
 aws_access_key_id = <from above>
 aws_secret_access_key = <from above>

 [Boto]
 debug = 1
 is_secure = 0
 cloudwatch_region_name = ceilometer
 cloudwatch_region_endpoint = 127.0.0.1

 vim heat/cfn_client/boto_client_cloudwatch.py
 change v1 to v2 in get_client()
 sudo python setup.py develop
 
 heat-watch -p 8777 metric-list

 ERROR:BotoServerError: 401 Unauthorized"}, {'account_id': 5055, 'date': '2013-07-30 07:26:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, Angus, very thanks for the review. 

The cloudwatch api is not very robust now, and I giving this change to be reviewed is to get some suggestion from ceilometer team.

For now, I have hit the following problems:

1. auth. I use keystone token to authenticate coming request, and ignore the aws_access_key_id and signature parameters, which results boto can't pass the authentication.

2. transition. cloudwatch and ceilometer glossary are quite
different, for now, I just use first dimensition's member to be as resource_id, and use cw's namespace as cm's source,
but I think it would be better to parse the meter name to be
namespace.

I need suggestion from your guys, thanks !"}, {'account_id': 5055, 'date': '2013-07-30 08:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For now, you can test it using curl with keystone token or boto client without authentication(set auth_strategy=noauth).'}, {'account_id': 5055, 'date': '2013-07-30 08:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

see some examples: http://paste.openstack.org/show/42590/'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-01 10:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

commit_message:
CloudWatch API for Ceilometer

If ceilometer has cloudwatch compatible api, then there are many tools
developed for aws cloudwatch can be used by ceilometer, which makes
ceilometer more general. Further more, this will also help people migrate
off of a closed system and on to an open one.

For now, there are three interfaces are implemented:
   * PutMetricData
   * ListMetrics
   * GetMetricStatistics

Change-Id: I8a267a4a2e97d0531bd83fc1b38d25022c7fce25
Implements: blueprint ceilometer-cloudwatch-api

commit_message:
Adds python2 to general packages to be installed

devstack works only for python2 python3 will break the install.
This commit adds python2 to the general dependencies of ubuntu

Change-Id: I7721ff85a63f635ff798407a5ee1d6766405c683
Closes-Bug: #1188215

(5 inline comments)

In general, such proposals will be automatically created by CI jobs when global requirements change. CI job for stable/havana was just fixed today, so here's the first batch:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 21:35:41.000000000', 'message': "Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo

This modification fixes Bug #1257829, specifically addressing the use
of a misspelled 'encryption' key to retrieve image encryption
information returned by calls to the 'qemu-img' command. In addition
to fixing the key ('encryption' -> 'encrypted'), the QemuImgInfo class
attribute has been renamed to reflect the change and the encryption
information added to the string representation of the class. Test
cases verifying the parsing of the encryption information are also
included.

Change-Id: Ice087d95c52506dec735921c6e9477caf082bf7e
Closes-Bug: #1257829
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo

This modification fixes Bug #1257829, specifically addressing the use
of a misspelled 'encryption' key to retrieve image encryption
information returned by calls to the 'qemu-img' command. In addition
to fixing the key ('encryption' -> 'encrypted'), the QemuImgInfo class
attribute has been renamed to reflect the change and the encryption
information added to the string representation of the class. Test
cases verifying the parsing of the encryption information are also
included.

Change-Id: Ice087d95c52506dec735921c6e9477caf082bf7e
Closes-Bug: #1257829

commit_message:
Wait for Neutron L2 Agent on Compute Node

The L2 Agent sometimes does not register until later on in the
deployment for some reason. This is just a work-around until that bug
can be properly understood.

Change-Id: Idbbc977aa2e13f2026de05ae7e6571bc9dd0a498
Closes-Bug: #1260440

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 23:17:51.000000000', 'message': 'Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: I6f6329d355dbeb1fe584e16a81845555bbb08ad3
Closes-Bug: 1252005
'}]
commit_message:
Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: I6f6329d355dbeb1fe584e16a81845555bbb08ad3
Closes-Bug: 1252005

commit_message:
Centralizing page size code, reading cookie

Centralizing duplicate code around the default page size.
Additionally, we now read the 'horizon_pagesize' cookie set for
the user in the settings panel to reuse the value across sessions.

Closes-bug: #1251456

Change-Id: I78b6c978926f53a598f89745c517b8083270e5ba

subject: Support MTU configuration for LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver
messages: [{'account_id': 7909, 'date': '2013-12-12 22:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nIndentationError.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 22:18:12.000000000', 'message': 'Support MTU configuration for LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver

Allow other MTU configuration for the tap device and the veth pair
then MTU 1500 when LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver is used.

Change-Id: I3e96375aa1bd2a0df44fe846fc6f5faf1d58269f
'}]
commit_message:
Support MTU configuration for LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver

Allow other MTU configuration for the tap device and the veth pair
then MTU 1500 when LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver is used.

Change-Id: I3e96375aa1bd2a0df44fe846fc6f5faf1d58269f

Thanks for the patch and apologies for the delays in reviewing it.

A couple of minor points to consider inline.

Also while I'm not too concerned about the hbase and db2 support being absent, I would like to have some indication of the intent WRT to mongodb support for events in general. Can you clarify if that's on your roadmap?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-12-11 22:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (2 inline comments)

Hi Eoghan, thanks for the review. Indeed, mongo will be landing soon after this patch. The rackspace team will be delivering that.'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2013-12-11 22:24:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

@Eoghan: We have a branch that we are working on here for Mongo event support. Right now we are doing some performance testing on it to optimize it. commit_message:
Event Storage Layer

This change adds the storage layer interfaces
necessary to implement the Event API. It also
updates the get_events call to allow multiple
trait filters.

implements bp specify-event-api

Change-Id: I7aef4a8fc9b88528479f6c0a9feab2c18945bae3

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix OS_AUTH_URL

Fix two places that used 127.0.0.1 as hostname instead of
controller as in the rest of the guide.

Change-Id: Ibc2bbb580c7b5c00bbed4dfa8071ca4596222d6b
backport: havana

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 14:46:02.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt imagebackend code refactoring

Move out calls os.path.exists() from the base imagebackend
implementation.

Change-Id: Ie6cdf0d6d9801f84fae7a58c1034547611712323
Closes-Bug: #1152748
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 15:12:06.000000000', 'message': 'Move calls to os.path.exists() in libvirt imagebackend

The checks for the path existence were removed from the base Image class
to avoid redundant checks (some of implementations also perform them and
behave differently depending on the results). Also special handling for
some backends were removed from the base Image class.

Change-Id: Ie6cdf0d6d9801f84fae7a58c1034547611712323
Closes-Bug: #1152748
'}]
commit_message:
Move calls to os.path.exists() in libvirt imagebackend

The checks for the path existence were removed from the base Image class
to avoid redundant checks (some of implementations also perform them and
behave differently depending on the results). Also special handling for
some backends were removed from the base Image class.

Change-Id: Ie6cdf0d6d9801f84fae7a58c1034547611712323
Closes-Bug: #1152748

- cascade deletes to metadata tables on meter deletion
- delete associations on object deletion

Closes-Bug: #1258071

commit_message:
add newly added constraints to expire clear_expired_metering_data

- cascade deletes to metadata tables on meter deletion
- delete associations on object deletion
- add check to not delete user/project entries associated with Alarm

Change-Id: I24cbaea9ede6d142dc22eaf070b3f7d1f14b484a
Closes-Bug: #1258071

commit_message:
config: specify a template for mktemp

It's actually not portable to use mktemp without an argument, so let's
add a default template.

Change-Id: I5c254b12c05457d9e3ed5788dabb4c317d97b4aa

commit_message:
check for invalid hostnames on update_attributes

Adds the hostname validation and username validation to the
update_attributes code for users to prevent bad data getting
into the system and breaking in unexpected places.

Change-Id: Ib501357e45e99945ab972ceed044efc1e2377de5
Closes-Bug: 1235845

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 01:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize storage reference architecture

 * Expand Storage Nodes subsection of Logical Setup with HA
   considerations for Ceph and Cinder LVM

 * Fix nesting level of the Neutron vs. nova-network section so that it
   and Savanna Deployment are subsections of Technical Considerations

 * Replace Swift specific Object Storage Deployment section with new
   Storage Architecture that covers all aspects of storage for OpenStack

 * Ceph deployment diagram for Storage Nodes subsection

 * Expanded explanation on when to use dedicated Swift nodes vs
   deploying all Swift services on controllers

 * Describe Ceph RBD support differences between vanilla Havana and
   Mirantis OpenStack 4.0

Change-Id: I9048a8299294716fe526f18eeab530c39477c4f2
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 01:29:18.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize storage reference architecture

 * Expand Storage Nodes subsection of Logical Setup with HA
   considerations for Ceph and Cinder LVM

 * Fix nesting level of the Neutron vs. nova-network section so that it
   and Savanna Deployment are subsections of Technical Considerations

 * Replace Swift specific Object Storage Deployment section with new
   Storage Architecture that covers all aspects of storage for OpenStack

 * Ceph deployment diagram for Storage Nodes subsection

 * Expanded explanation on when to use dedicated Swift nodes vs
   deploying all Swift services on controllers

 * Describe Ceph RBD support differences between vanilla Havana and
   Mirantis OpenStack 4.0

Change-Id: I9048a8299294716fe526f18eeab530c39477c4f2
'}]
commit_message:
Reorganize storage reference architecture

 * Expand Storage Nodes subsection of Logical Setup with HA
   considerations for Ceph and Cinder LVM

 * Fix nesting level of the Neutron vs. nova-network section so that it
   and Savanna Deployment are subsections of Technical Considerations

 * Replace Swift specific Object Storage Deployment section with new
   Storage Architecture that covers all aspects of storage for OpenStack

 * Ceph deployment diagram for Storage Nodes subsection

 * Expanded explanation on when to use dedicated Swift nodes vs
   deploying all Swift services on controllers

 * Describe Ceph RBD support differences between vanilla Havana and
   Mirantis OpenStack 4.0

Change-Id: I9048a8299294716fe526f18eeab530c39477c4f2
